<div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> This Analyst supports the Regulation &amp; Markets department in oversight of the commercial activities and associated risks for EDPR’s North American operations. This position works with all areas of the organization to analyze and explain the regulatory frameworks underlying electrical power markets, renewable energy credit markets, and distributed generation markets. Understanding and describing market details and fundamentals and the implications for EDPR assets are key focus areas for this role. Successful candidates for this role will be comfortable with following the developments of current markets and projecting the evolution of markets by assessing market fundamentals. In addition, the Analyst will learn to synthesize and communicate key trends and evaluate the impact of their outlooks on existing assets, new solar, wind, storage, and hydrogen asset investments, and EDPR’s competitive positioning in different markets. This position will be on a hybrid work schedule, working three days in the office and two days from home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES AND TASKS<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Fundamental market analysis -<\u002Fb> Evaluate key market drivers and their impact on our business as a basis for making decisions about commercial transactions and risk policy.<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Pricing and valuation -<\u002Fb> Develop forward price curves and fair valuation models incorporating both fundamental and price analytic factors for use in support of investment decisions, power purchase agreement and other deal negotiations, and risk assessment as well as in internal strategic planning processes.<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Energy Outlook <\u002Fb>– Participate in the development of the annual Energy Outlook by developing fundamental scenarios to evaluate how prices could evolve under different regulatory situations and under different fuel price scenarios.<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Market Outlook <\u002Fb>– Participate in the preparation of the quarterly update of market fundamentals and commercial activity.<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Pipeline Planning <\u002Fb>– Participate in the process that sets the framework for profitable growth for EDP Renewables NA. Synthesize regulatory and commodity outlooks to identify markets to target siting of new wind, solar, and storage assets. Identify actions to be taken in the current year that will drive growth through the six year planning horizon.<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>New investments analysis – <\u002Fb>Participate in investment decision process by building alternative cases for new investments. Analyze potential risks in new investments and recommend mitigation strategies.<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Periodic strategic analysis<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b>REQUIREMENTS<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Academic Background<\u002Fb><b>: <\u002Fb>Degree in Engineering, Business Administration, or Economics preferred.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Languages: <\u002Fb>Ability to read, write and speak English fluently, Spanish and Portuguese are also valuable.<br> <b>Professional Experience: <\u002Fb>0-3 yrs<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Skills\u002FCompetencies:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Good analytical and quantitative skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Data modeling and visualization skills are helpful<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Good ability to communicate in both written and verbal form<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Qualifications<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The OSE Inspector is responsible for managing the quality and delivery of owner-supplied equipment (OSE) meeting specifications as designed by EDPR NA to ensure on-time delivery and quality of components. The Senior OSE Equipment Expeditor &amp; Inspector, will have extensive experience in supplier quality and\u002For expediting, will utilize expertise to improve the quality and timely delivery of OSE to ensure it meets the project schedule by coordinating with Procurement and the project team. This is a 12 month temporary assignment with full benefits.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Serve as key point of contact for the Technical Department to manage the quality and delivery of Owner Supplied Equipment (OSE) and Major Project equipment to support project schedules by effectively communicating with the project teams<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure that equipment is delivered on schedule and in accordance to specifications<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Coordinate with vendors to inspect equipment as required to ensure quality, readiness, and true location of components<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Expedite equipment per agreed procurement plans as needed to support project schedule<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage and maintain supplier equipment delivery schedules via regular supplier communications and site visits<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform risk assessment of supplier delivery schedules and proactively develop recovery plans to mitigate delivery delays<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop and provide weekly reports to management and project teams on the status of OSE and project equipment to ensure components are on track to support project plans and schedules<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Build strong and effective relationships with internal key stakeholders and suppliers<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify material and related documentation as prescribed by the purchase order\u002Fsales order or contract specifications highlighting any nonconformance or omission.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b> <\u002Fb><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>0; will indirectly manage multiple internal customers and external vendors\u002Fcontractors<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> 100% travel, per diem, 3 weeks on 1 week off rotational assignments.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> <\u002Fb><b>Minimum qualifications: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>HS Diploma or equivalent is required, or other related experience required.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>8-10 years of experience in quality, procurement, construction, transportation, logistics, and OEM manufacturing in support of construction projects is preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong background in inspecting and expediting equipment in support of wind, solar and BESS<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience working with vendors for solar PV’s, wind turbines and BESS<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience and proficiency in performing on-site quality system assessments and evaluating suppliers' ability to produce the needed products, stakeholders<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience working with cross-functional and international teams<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to manage multiple projects across multiple geographies<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Able to work independently, as well as in a team environment<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to quickly understand the basics of a variety of subjects relating to wind and solar energy including resource studies, environmental and cultural studies, transmission issues, public relations, public policy, sales, and civil and electrical engineering<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong interpersonal skills and high attention to details<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong analytical and quantitative skills<\u002Fli> \n multitask<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to travel extensively domestically and internationally, by plane, by car, and with short notice<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently perform physical tasks including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching approximately 75% of the time while on wind farm sites; ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Walking: <\u002Fb>Ability to walk 1 mile per day, including across unpaved and rough surfaces when on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b>Lifting: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently lift items weighing up to 60 pounds and to occasionally lift items weighing between 60 and 100 pounds<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b>Climbing:<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Ability to climb turbine towers<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Weight, including harness and tools, <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>The ROCC Specialist will be responsible for directing, monitoring, and coordinating the operation of EDPR NA wind assets from the Remote Operations Control Center (ROCC). You will ensure that Wind Power Plants (WPP) operations comply with all applicable North American Electric Reliability Corporation (NERC) standards and practices. You should be able to work well independently, with guidance in only complex situations.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Monitor real-time control center operations and performing wind farms across the US and apply established procedures in order to guarantee maximum availability, sale of energy, and wind farm service<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Report and document the status of forced and planned plant outages to Regional Transmission Organizations\u002F Independent System Operators ( RTO\u002FISO)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop and implement effective strategies to maximize the WPP value by capturing profit opportunities in the real-time power markets<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Evaluate system alarms and irregularities, taking corrective action as outlined in established guidelines<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure quality and accuracy of EDPR NA real-time generation information being telemetered to RTO\u002FISO<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Call-out field and emergency service personnel when appropriate<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Direct electrical substation switching at EDPR NA facilities using a detailed understanding of the Company’s electrical switching practices<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure turbine and substation data integrity for internal databases used for reporting<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Use OEM SCADA (Original Equipment Manufacturer Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition) to control the real and reactive power of the 5 unique types of turbines now in use<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain an understanding of the energy markets where company assets are located<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain an understanding of commercial practices as they relate to managing merchant power pricing and scheduling<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Associate’s degree in Electrical Engineering or an equivalent combination of training and experience<\u002Fli> \n     <li>3+ years in power system operations, power production, or related energy operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Must be willing to obtain EDPR NA ROCC Operator certification within 9 months from the date of hire<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Must already have or be willing to obtain PJM System Operator certification within 12 months from the date of hire<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Thorough knowledge of AC theory and power flow; Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office software, OSI PI, and <p> The Benefits Lead reports to the Vice President of People and Organization (P&amp;O) and lead and assume responsibility for the management of the organization's health and welfare, well-being plans and the company's 401K savings plans.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Responsible for the management of benefits strategy that is fully aligned of the benefit programs. implementing process improvements for maintaining and effectively using employee data.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Responsible for accuracy of benefits census data in the HRIS to provide vendors with accurate eligibility information.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Responsible for developing analysis and recommendation for annual renewal decisions for the employee benefit plans and related services.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Consults with vendors to identify and discuss areas for future design changes, better employee communication and other improvements to program administration.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Lead the administering the annual open enrollment process and employee education, including verifying eligibility, managing the EOI process and ensuring that all employees receive required materials for completion of open enrollment.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work closely with the P&amp;O Leadership &amp; Executive leadership, regarding benefits claim issues, plan changes and 401K administration.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Responsible to ensure all benefits vendors are paid accurately according to the executed contracts.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure an effective ongoing communication its affiliates, and its subsidiaries develop, construct, own, and operate wind farms and solar parks throughout North America. Headquartered in Houston, Texas, with 58 wind farms, nine solar parks, and eight regional offices across North America, EDPR NA has developed more than 8,800 megawatts (MW) and operates more than 8,200 MW of onshore utility-scale renewable energy projects. With more than 950 employees, EDPR NA’s highly qualified team has a proven capacity to execute projects across the continent.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Our paid internship program are ideal for those in their third year of university (graduating 2023 or 2024), looking to gain hands on experience in a leading renewable company.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Our intern positions will officially open in late Fall 2022\u002FEarly Spring 2023, apply to this requisition to stay in touch with the University Recruiter. its affiliates, and its subsidiaries develop, construct, own, and operate wind farms and solar parks throughout North America. Headquartered in Houston, Texas, with 58 wind farms, nine solar parks, and eight regional offices across North America, EDPR NA has developed more than 8,800 megawatts (MW) and operates more than 8,200 MW of onshore utility-scale renewable energy projects. With more than 950 employees, EDPR NA’s highly qualified team has a proven capacity to execute projects across the continent.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Our paid internship program are ideal for those in their third year of university (graduating 2023 or 2024), looking to gain hands on experience in a leading renewable company.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Our intern positions will officially open in late Fall 2022\u002FEarly Spring 2023, apply to this requisition to stay in touch with the University Recruiter. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>The Asset Manager supports financial and commercial oversight for projects in the assigned region (between 800 and 2000 MW) and ensures all commercial and contractual obligations are met. You will plan and track asset budgets, develop market knowledge and oversee performance. Additional responsibilities will include supporting the management of fleet commercial relationships with turbine OEMs and O&amp;M service providers (in excess of 2000MW) and ensuring that the operations strategy and management framework developed by the Asset Management team is implemented consistently across assigned projects.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> M<\u002Fb><b>ain accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Plan and support project profit &amp; loss (P&amp;L) activities for assigned assets<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the development of project-level annual budgets and creation of longer-term business plans in collaboration with other Asset Operations groups<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Performs budget analyses (such as variance report and reforecast) for the assigned assets and provide explanations regarding financial and operation performance of assigned assets<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Facilitate Service Agreements, RFPs, negotiate with service providers and support execution of contracts by working with Procurement and Legal<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Interface with Operations, Performance Management, turbine original equipment manufacturers, and service providers to identify means of increasing performance and reducing risk exposure<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Support commercial effort towards resolution of significant issues that stem from the operation of the project (e.g., equipment warranties, O&amp;M disputes and performance metrics, landowner agreements, PPAs, financing agreements, wind forecasting, tax agreements, interconnection agreements, and others) )<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Utilize project management techniques and practices to lead cross functional teams to resolve material issues affecting operational projects<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Drive initiatives across the portfolio in an effort to improve fleet performance by facilitating solutions with input from other groups in the company; track execution of solutions<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Perform ad-hoc analyses of the historical and forward-looking performance of the asset and provide insights and expertise to support quality of analysis. Support Performance Management in creation of business cases and Proposal for Decisions for various initiatives<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Track and manage obligations and activities to ensure commercial and governmental obligations are met by understanding key milestones within the major agreements (e.g., turbine supply, O&amp;M, PPA, tax equity, landowner, and interconnection)<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Contribute in developing and refining operational strategies<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Work with other Asset Management staff and the Accounting team to ensure that reporting obligations are met in a timely manner<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Track and manage obligations and activities related to bringing new projects from construction into operations, including PPA, LGIA, ISO and other requirements)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Meet reporting obligations to financing entities by providing necessary commentary and reports as required under the company’s financing obligations. Interface with Portfolio Management on matters impacting the performance of the assigned assets<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Create and develop market knowledge<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Communicate with various market balancing authorities as needed<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Notify relevant staff and help to resolve issues when milestones are delinquent, or a trigger event has occurred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Collaborate with other staff to ensure that proper asset management processes and tasks are in place in order to improve overall facility performance and limit risk exposure<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Direct reports<\u002Fb><b>:<\u002Fb> None<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Pre-Operations Engineer will provide engineering support to the Control Center, High Voltage Operations, and Operational Technology teams in the areas of plant integration, compliance, process effectiveness, betterment project development, and interdepartmental communication.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Acquire a thorough understanding of EDPR NA’s assets and processes<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in the engineering, design, and construction review processes including review of communication systems, SCADA, collection system, substation, and transmission line designs<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with incorporating “Lessons Learned” in the Engineering Design Standards and Standard HV BOP Scope of Work documents from a compliance and operations perspective<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Collaborate with Construction, Engineering, and the Project Management Organization to set and hold commissioning milestone dates related to project transition and integration<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist in the design and integration of new projects’ plant controls through the preparation of grid connection forms<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support commissioning, start-up, and initial operating activities of new projects<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support testing and commissioning of plant SCADA and power plant control Systems<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide input to engineering and construction to improve commissioning procedures and SOP’s (Standard Operating Procedures)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Review commissioning records to identify deficiencies and recommend corrective actions to ensure compliance with the applicable NERC standards<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure procedures are in place for safe and efficient switching operations for plants under construction<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide recommendations for optimization of startup of High Voltage and Control Equipment spare parts<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Interact closely with internal and external stakeholders to ensure that project needs, and objectives are met<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in project meetings and conference calls<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Interpret plans, specifications, drawings, and documents related to renewable power plants<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in due-diligence review of renewable power project’s electrical designs<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in investigations of electrical and control related issues at construction projects including root cause analyses as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain the knowledge sharing databases to include compliance efforts and other internal compliance tracking tools and provide suggestions for process improvements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in various task forces related to RCA’s, compliance investigations, and other operational investigations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Other duties as assigned<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Electrical Inspector will oversee activities relating to the construction of electrical systems including substations and underground or overhead electrical transmission systems in order to ensure that defined requirements of schedule and quality are being met. This is a 12-month temporary assignment with full benefits.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Provide daily oversight and regular inspections of the electrical system construction installation including substations, underground and overhead electrical collection systems, transmission lines, electrical equipment, and communications equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain effective lines of communication with all company personnel responsible for the project as well as general contractors and sub-contractors<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Properly and effectively perform electrical construction tasks as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Prepare daily reports outlining the progress of the work<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure that electrical construction installations are completed in accordance with project documents and specifications<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Review and comment on contractors’ schedules and provide assistance to the project team in meeting the overall project objectives<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Attend seminars regarding code changes<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports:<\u002Fb> None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> Up to 20%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Successful completion of a four-year apprenticeship program or an equivalent combination of training and experience that includes seven years of related work experience and attainment of a journeyman’s card<\u002Fli> \n     <li>5+ years supervising crews and electrical jobs<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Thorough knowledge of NEC and local codes, high-voltage safety codes, electrical theory, mathematics, electrical construction, maintenance methods, and the proper use of personal protective equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Understanding of Microsoft products and\u002For complementing products preferred.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in Analytical Problem Solving, Strong Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise preferred<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to comprehend all construction documents including blueprints and drawings<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to exhibit a professional demeanor to customers and other employees<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Visual acuity including sufficient depth perception, color recognition, and field of vision necessary to perform visual inspections, work with small parts, and take accurate measurements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong problem-solving, statistical, and analytical skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Verbal and written communication and presentation skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to be self-motivated<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n construction.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Responsible for local state, federal, and regional permitting of providers and third parties<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage the environmental study and permitting process<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the financial analysis and modeling of the project<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage project level expenditures and invoice processing<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop project budgets<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in interconnection agreement negotiations<\u002Fli> \n  <p> Counsel will provide legal advice to EDPR NA personnel regarding all aspects of renewable energy project development, construction, operation, acquisition, disposition, and financing, including (i) providing support to M&amp;A transactions, (ii) the preparation and negotiation of agreements related to the acquisition or disposition of renewable energy projects, such as letters of intent, purchase and sale agreements, shareholders agreements, and other ancillary agreements such as confidentiality agreements and assignment and assumption agreements, and (iii) the preparation and negotiation of agreements related to the development, construction and operation of renewable energy facilities, which agreements may include equipment purchase agreements, the balance of plant agreements, turbine supply agreements, operation and maintenance agreements, power purchase agreements, and other related documentation, all in accordance with EDPR NA objectives and policies. Counsel will also handle day-to-day project-related legal issues, support and provide legal expertise to Company staff, and analyze exposure to risk factors while complying with departmental guidelines, company policies, and all applicable laws in order to ensure that EDPR NA’s documents and activities meet all applicable requirements. This position will be on a hybrid work schedule, working three days in the office and two days from home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Draft, negotiate and finalize project-development and operations contracts, including without limitation, engineering service agreements, shared facilities agreements, EPC agreements, construction agreements, interconnection agreements and consulting services agreements, affiliate agreements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Handles day-to-day legal issues encountered at the corporate office and operational project sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist, as directed, with M&amp;A transactions, joint ventures, asset rotation transactions, and tax equity transactions<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Coordinate efforts with other internal teams, including investments and M&amp;A, finance, real estate, tax, environmental, permitting and regulatory<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Conduct project M&amp;A due diligence and provide legal support and analysis on project development related issues<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Review, draft and negotiate transaction documents such as asset purchase agreements, equity purchase and sale agreements, capital contribution agreements, shareholders agreements and limited liability company agreements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Review, draft and negotiate ancillary agreements such as LOIs and confidentiality agreements, assignment agreements, and termination agreements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Draft and manage necessary corporate governance work, including preparation of resolutions and certificates<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Coordinate efforts with the legal and business teams regarding corporate and project requirements to ensure maximum value and appropriate risk management for EDPR NA and its shareholders<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify critical project risk issues and communicate those risks to the appropriate members of the legal team or your supervisor for resolution and management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Efficiently manage outside counsel with an eye toward minimizing expenses<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform other tasks and projects as assigned<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Performance Monitoring Analyst develops and monitors performance indicators to detect and resolve issues related to the operation of wind and solar assets. Performs root cause analysis of deficiencies and proposes solutions in coordination with engineering teams. Manages the resolution of detected issues and communicates statuses with Asset Operations and Performance Management departments. Coordinates with global team members in North America and Europe.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Perform analyses of solar and wind turbine performance to identify performance improvement opportunities and complete detailed comparisons against targets<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Perform root cause analysis (RCA) of detections in collaboration with Engineering and Operations teams<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Develop reporting capabilities and create interactive business intelligence (BI) reports to support monitoring efforts<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Manage detected items to track resolution and added value<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Ensure quality control of performance datasets by confirming accuracy against original sources, checking for errors manually and automatically, and updating datasets regularly<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Maintain relationship with Asset Managers and managers of operating sites, enabling successful plant operations by providing timely detections and escalating issues and opportunities identified<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Work as part of a global team, supporting and leading initiatives that enhance the group’s capabilities and performance<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Write ad-hoc queries in SQL, PI and Azure databases to capture data for analysis<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Work with technical staff to identify turbine modifications that can increase performance and quantifies potential financial benefits<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Additional duties as required<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Direct reports:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>GENERAL DESCRIPTION:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Market Operations Manager will be responsible for all nodal power fundamental analysis supporting EDPR’s nodal trading activities in North America wholesale electricity markets. This includes power system transmission analysis, LMP and congestion analysis to guide EDPR’s congestion hedging effort, day-ahead scheduling, virtual trading, asset-backed and prop trading.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Develop and maintain a fundamental analysis framework to support all nodal trading activities for NA wholesale power markets.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform transmission modeling and SCED analysis using Dayzer (or other) and provide congestion and basis forecast, shaping basis hedging strategies (FTR bidding, basis swaps) to manage EDPR’s basis risk exposure.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Analyze and provide guidance on FTRs value, forward price and transmission congestion dynamics and evolution.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform transmission load flow and LMP analysis of the various ISOs systems to assess impact on EDPR’s operating assets and support short-term asset optimization.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Track transmission and generation outages, line upgrades and\u002For new builds, and generation retirements; model them and evaluate impact on LMP and transmission congestion dynamics.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the structuring and pricing of off-take transactions within GEM.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Collaborate with other Departments requiring GEM support such as Origination, Finance, Investments and M&amp;A.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work as part of a team, participating in special projects\u002Fduties as assigned by team leader.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Bachelor degree in Engineering, Economics, Mathematics or related fields, Master’s degree preferred.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>5+ years of utility industry or related experience<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Hands on experience in nodal market and LMP forecasting tools (Dayzer or UPLAN, Promod, etc).<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Thorough knowledge of power flow software (e.g. PSSE).<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office software.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of SQL, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), and Power BI.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to program in Visual Basic, Matlab or Python is a plus.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in Analytical Problem Solving and Strong Communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> BEHAVIORAL REQUIREMENTS<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Excellent organizational in environmental issues and renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Associate General Counsel will, in coordination with the EDPR NA Chief Legal Officer and the EDPR NA DG Chief Executive Officer, manage the legal affairs of EDPR NA DG and its subsidiaries, including corporate governance matters, support of project development and construction matters, financing, and acquisitions, including contract negotiations and transactions, litigation management, and compliance with applicable laws and regulations and company policies. You will also provide legal advice to company personnel related to the same. This position will be on a hybrid work schedule, working three days in the office and two days from home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Supervise attorneys and paralegal staff<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Mentor legal staff and collaborate with staff as needed to facilitate their professional development<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide overall project legal guidance and support to company staff in the development, construction, operation, and administration of distributed generation solar power and storage projects<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop corporate and project requirements with the Chief Legal Officer and DG CEO to ensure maximum value and appropriate risk management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Coordinate with the Chief Legal Officer to ensure the company’s compliance with all pertinent federal, state, and local laws<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop policies and procedures to ensure the company’s compliance with applicable laws and business plans<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide legal support to the commercial team with respect to both project development and transactional work, such as project acquisitions, site control, offtake agreements, and construction and maintenance contracts<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Lead and finalize contractual drafting and negotiations in respect of the suite of contracts required for the acquisition, development, and construction of various projects<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist project managers with contract administration, claims, and dispute management<\u002Fli> \n     <li> Provide concise and commercially minded legal advice to the business to support project outcomes and address the legal risks.<\u002Fli> \n     <li> Assist in corporate governance requirements of the business, including establishing new entities, drafting corporate documentation, and tracking compliance with annual filings<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Initiate and promote knowledge sharing, expertise, and skills within the legal department and broader commercial team, including developing precedent contracts and implementing best practice guidelines<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work closely with other members of the legal department to assist in finalizing project finance arrangements and tax equity investments in respect of various projects<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide other general day-to-day legal assistance as required, including undertaking legal research, drafting various contracts and legal templates, reviewing non-disclosure agreements, and updating internal policies<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Guide the selection and management of external legal resources to ensure efficient and effective completion of tasks<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop and manage an effective schedule for the assignment and utilization of legal resources<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify critical project risk issues and make recommendations to senior management for their resolution<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide training to company personnel<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with other legal matters as assigned<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p> <b>Direct reports:<\u002Fb> 3-5 direct and indirect reports<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>as needed<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li> JD, LLM, and\u002For LLB from an accredited university<\u002Fli> \n     <li> Admitted to the bar in one more state, preferably Texas or New York<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Minimum 7 years post-admission experience (ideally, a combination of law firm and in-house)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience leading the negotiation, drafting, and finalization of the suite of project development contracts is essential. its affiliates, and its subsidiaries develop, construct, own, and operate wind farms and solar parks throughout North America. Headquartered in Houston, Texas, with 58 wind farms, nine solar parks, and eight regional offices across North America, EDPR NA has developed more than 8,800 megawatts (MW) and operates more than 8,200 MW of onshore utility-scale renewable energy projects. With more than 950 employees, EDPR NA’s highly qualified team has a proven capacity to execute projects across the continent.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Our paid internship program are ideal for those in their third year of university (graduating 2023 or 2024), looking to gain hands on experience in a leading renewable company.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Our intern positions will officially open in late Fall 2022\u002FEarly Spring 2023, apply to this requisition to stay in touch with the University Recruiter. <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Procurement Associate (Operations &amp; Maintenance) is responsible for sourcing, analyzing, negotiating and executing vendor contracts for the operations and maintenance of EDPR wind farms.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Create, implement, and manage competitive bid processes for all O&amp;M materials and services for EDPR NA operating fleet with total spend exceeding $100M annually.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage the execution of more than 100 contracts annually while incorporating more than 100 bidders throughout the RFP process<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist Services, Materials, &amp; Operations Procurement Manager with the development of contracting strategies and processes for tendering Requests for Proposals (RFPs),<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Review and level vendor proposals and negotiate contracts that result in the best value possible<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Serve as a liaison between the Procurement, Operations, and Asset Management departments<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop and manage purchasing plans and strategies relating to the operation of the company’s wind farms to drive contracting efficiency and leverage spend volume<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage relationships and interface with suppliers during the RFP and negotiation processes<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain responsibility for technical bid evaluations, commercial, and contractual negotiations, and contract approval prior to contract finalization<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with the creation and documentation of a competitive bid process that can be used at all levels of the organization<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with the contract award review, analysis, and presentation of award recommendations to management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with the training of personnel in negotiations and contract management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with the development of standardized processes and templates for all contracting efforts<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage documentation, contracts, budgets, schedules, project controls, project correspondence, project reporting, and Operations and Asset Management interfaces,<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain reporting tools including but not limited to Supplier financial performance, historical purchases, O&amp;M market intelligence, and Operations technical satisfaction<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Organize and prepare agendas for meetings between suppliers and Procurement personnel<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Issue purchase  <p> Manages and oversees business development activities for the Distributed Generation platform of the company, including winning new business, supporting solar development efforts, and joint partnerships to develop, build, and operate solar projects. This position will be responsible for advancing new business growth, finding new channels, and maintaining consistency within the business development activities across the platform. The selected candidate will facilitate the early identification of accounts and manage opportunities through the financial closing and subsequent advancement steps to consistent with the company’s business plan, policies, and practices.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Manage and oversee business development activities, including solar development efforts and joint partnerships to develop, build, and operate new projects<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop lines of organic growth through agreements with technology providers, local partners, developers, investors, and other external parties<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Achieve internal approval of decisions by produce internal documentation and coordinating activities with relevant parties<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support business development activities outside of the North American platform as required by the EDPR DG team<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide technical, analytical, and strategic support to Associate Directors as needed during the contracting and development phases of distributed generation projects, mergers, acquisitions, and joint partnership transaction opportunities<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the anticipation or identification of prospective markets with attractive potential for distributed generation solar development<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the identification of prospective projects with suitable solar resources, commercial attractiveness, and access to the grid<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Coordinate the review and update of the company’s priority projects list on an ongoing basis with leadership team members<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Monitor the overall profitability of the priority projects and target pipeline to confirm that projects’ NPV is aligned with market conditions and company expectations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Coordinate with the Associate Directors to define business development contributions to platform’s pipeline<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Prepare, review, and oversee ongoing maintenance and upkeep of suitable sales\u002Foperational pipeline maturity to ensure efficient, timely, and accurate reporting for all regions in a consolidated report<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Communicate effectively with team members and colleagues to ensure consistency in the development activities within the platform<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively propose continuous improvement initiatives and drive initiatives to completion.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support development activities and manage the direct work of third-parties including engineering firms, financial institutions, and regulatory bodies to advance deals through the pipeline as required<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Research market and competition on an ongoing basis to identify best practices and improvement opportunities<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Conduct and manage all work in a timely fashion to ensure that critical deadlines are met<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Mentor, guide, and teach junior team members and new staff on company practices<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional tasks or duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>2 reports of project and internal stakeholders (preferably in the energy industry), including financial investors, equipment manufacturers, wholesale electricity customers, and consultants; demonstrated success managing multi-disciplinary teams<\u002Fli> \n     <li>2 years of demonstrated transaction closing experience with complex business to business sales cycles for seven-figure transactions<\u002Fli> \n management assistance and task management supporting the development of renewable energy (wind and solar) projects from site identification through construction. This is a fast-paced and multi-faceted role facing multiple internal and external stakeholders and provides immediate exposure to commercial matters.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Identify and organize the development of wind and solar projects by creating and updating project maps and databases using GIS tools<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Represent EDPRNA in the field, working with Project Managers and landowners to create and amend agreements, options, leases, and land sales<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with community outreach and other stakeholder management activities<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Conduct land, market, regulatory, and related project research<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Compile documentation, attend meetings, conduct necessary studies, and perform other tasks as needed to obtain permits for solar projects at the local, state, and federal level<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with efforts to secure transmission and interconnection rights from utilities and transmission providers<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in the preparation of proposals that are submitted to power purchasers including utilities, community choice aggregators, and commercial &amp; industrial customers<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support internal reporting and project tracking efforts<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> up to 65%<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Environmental Sciences, or a related field<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1 – 2 years of progressively responsible project management or development experience in energy or a related industry<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong knowledge of ESRI ArcGIS and Google Earth software preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office software with strong Excel skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in Analytical Problem Solving, Strong Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Project Counsel will provide legal advice to EDPR NA personnel regarding all aspects of utility-scale renewable energy project development, construction, and operations. The Project Counsel will provide support to project financing activities and the preparation and negotiation of power purchase agreements, capital equipment supply and warranty agreements, construction agreements, operations and maintenance agreements, engineering service agreements, consulting service agreements, development agreements and other relevant documentation, all in accordance with EDPR NA objectives and policies. The Project Counsel will also handle day to day project-related legal issues and provide legal expertise to Company staff and analyze exposure to risk factors while complying with departmental guidelines and all applicable laws in order to ensure that EDPR NA’s project documents and activities meet all applicable requirements.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Provide legal expertise and support to EDPR NA staff in the development, execution, administration, and operations of utility-scale renewable energy projects<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with development project teams throughout the development process by providing legal advice on issues as they arise and providing solutions that meet project objectives while complying with departmental guidelines<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop, review, and recommend changes to legal aspects of project documents to improve efficiency and risk mitigation<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Timely prepare, negotiate, and finalize various project agreements including power purchase agreement, capital equipment supply and warranty agreements, construction agreements, interconnection agreements, engineering and consulting service agreements, operations and maintenance agreements, confidentiality agreements, filings and applications to various local, <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Priority Project Manager will report to and support the Directors and Associate Directors of Project Management to deliver wind and solar projects on schedule and under budget. The project manager will focus on identifying and managing risks associated with project schedules and budgets, support efforts to track and reforecast project budgets and support strategic planning efforts for individual projects. Will work hybrid schedule, 3 days in office and 2 days remote from home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Implement and improve project management tools that directly impact and drive business decisions related to the project schedule and budget.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the creation, tracking, updating and reporting of project schedules and progress. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Track and coordinate with relevant internal support teams and project analysts to complete monthly project budget reforecasts and update project economics. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Responsible for weekly maintenance and reporting on project progress reports. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Assist with project due diligence process for project financing including technical support as well as tracking and closing open items from investors and independent engineer.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Tracking project lessons learned and compiling and presenting these to internal stakeholders.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support CAPEX estimate reviews for priority projects<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with strategic planning including collaborating with project teams in the drafting, tracking and updating of Project Execution Plans.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Attend weekly project calls and lend support with regard to schedule and budget tracking and updating as well as identifying and escalating risks that arise during weekly meetings.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb>None <\u002Fp>\n    <p><b>Travel:<\u002Fb> 25%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> project management experience in energy or a related industry.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Understanding of Microsoft products including Microsoft Project scheduling tool.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in Analytical Problem Solving, Strong Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise preferred<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral Description:<\u002Fb>\n     <br> The Civil Inspector will provide oversight for the construction of projects’ civil components in accordance with plan specifications and departmental guidelines in order to ensure that requirements regarding schedule, cost, and quality are met. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Exciting entry-level position, the Field Service Technician I (Wind Tech) is an essential member of the Wind or Solar Farm that is responsible for the on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of equipment at one of EDPR NA’s wind-energy generation sites. Tasks include but are not limited to completing Lock-Out-Tag-Out (LOTO), Tail Board, and documentation that is necessary to support wind turbine maintenance safely. This team member will also conduct inspections of equipment, tools, and facilities for compliance with EDPR policies, governmental safety guidelines, and environmental regulations. The ideal candidate is seeking an opportunity to showcase their knowledge and skills in a dynamic team setting with a passion for renewable energy as EDPR is changing tomorrow now!<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind plant equipment including substation and tower switchgear<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job-appropriate processes and procedures and communicate through appropriate channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify gaps in safety standards and safety risks in the environment, implement effective risk mitigation and provide recommendations to higher-level technical staff and management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Demonstrate and promote integrity, strong initiative, and teamwork<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs and act as a safety role model<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with and respond to EDPRs Remote Operations Control Center when necessary to coordinate remote operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Complete all required training in a satisfactory manner and timeframe<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in on-the-job training with on-site personnel<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Document all work performed using computer-based service reporting procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Adhere to internal controls in effect<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>Up to 10%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>High school diploma or GED<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Must possess a valid driver’s license and be able to operate a motor vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Effective Communicator<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Mechanical and electrical aptitude<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Troubleshooting and analysis skills.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Preferred: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Technical school education; or an equivalent combination of training and experience.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1 – 2 years relevant experience in wind energy or a related industry.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Understanding of Microsoft products and\u002For complementing products.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong analytical Problem Solving, Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with power plant operations and maintenance, wind plant operations and turbines (including turbine power converters specifically), high voltage switching, and post-operational repair and maintenance of turbines.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Familiarity with maintenance and electronic testing equipment (e.g., voltage testers, amp clamps, hydraulic torque equipment, alignment tools, various hand, and power tools) and with heavy equipment required for facility maintenance including working knowledge of crane and rigging requirements.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge SQL Server software, facility management and reporting systems, and computerized diagnostic and troubleshooting tools<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to work around low- and medium-voltage equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to travel occasionally to other operational sites within the US as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to work overtime on holidays and weekends and to work on short notice as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to respond to site emergencies 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, as needed<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently perform physical tasks including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching approximately 75% of the time while on wind farm sites; ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Walking: <\u002Fb>Ability to walk .25 to .5 miles per day, including across unpaved and rough surfaces when on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or scheduled form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Lifting: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently lift items weighing up to 50 pounds<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Climbing:<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Ability to climb turbine towers in excess of 100 meters in height to access the work area<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Weight, including harness and tools, must be in accordance with the weight limit as specified by the ANSI Fall Protection Standards<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <li><b>Vision\u002FHearing: <\u002Fb>Ability to interpret and follow a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Tolerance to Extreme Weather Conditions: <\u002Fb>Ability to work in adverse weather conditions 25% of the time while on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Safety:<\u002Fb> Ability to understand and communicate safety precautions when necessary.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Travel Solar Procurement Associate is responsible for all aspects of the Solar Plant services contract process including market research, supplier analysis, selection strategy, final negotiation, and construction and operations turnover. The role will require a significant amount of interaction with internal and external stakeholders including executive-level leadership.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Create, implement, and manage competitive bid processes for all solar project Engineering, Environmental, Development, Design, Construction, Operations, and Maintenance services required by EDPR NA, with a total spend exceeding $100M annually<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Manage the execution of more than 50 contracts annually by incorporating numerous bidders throughout the RFP processes<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Assist Senior Services &amp; Materials Procurement Manager with the development of contracting strategies and processes for tendering Requests for Proposals (RFPs), reviewing and leveling vendor proposals, negotiating contracts that result in the best value possible, and mentoring Services &amp; Materials team members on varying aspects of project management, contracting strategy, and negotiation<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Serve as a liaison between the Procurement, Development, Environmental, Energy Assessment, Engineering, Project Management, Operations, and Asset Management departments<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Develop and manage purchasing plans and strategies relating to the development, construction, and operation of the company’s solar farms<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Identify and qualify a robust supplier database of national to local (state, county) contractors to support all services for new Solar projects<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Track the global and U.S. solar markets and monitor technological advances in the industry<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Manage vendor relationships and interface with suppliers during the RFP and negotiation processes<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Maintain responsibility for bid evaluations, commercial and contractual negotiations, and contract approval prior to contract finalization<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Assist Investment\u002FM&amp;A, Estimation, and Origination departments for potential solar project acquisitions including but not limited to market trends, estimation, commercial terms review, and requests for information<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Assist with the creation and documentation of a competitive bid process that can be used at all levels of the organization<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Assist with the contract award process and presentation of award recommendations to management<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Assist with the development of standardized processes and templates for all contracting efforts<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Manage documentation, contracts, budgets, schedules, engineering and construction interfaces, project controls, project correspondence, and project reporting<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Organize and prepare agendas for meetings between suppliers and Procurement personnel <\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Issue purchase orders<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Exciting entry-level position, the Field Service Technician I (Wind Tech) is an essential member of the Wind or Solar Farm that is responsible for the on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of equipment at one of EDPR NA’s wind-energy generation sites. Tasks include but are not limited to completing Lock-Out-Tag-Out (LOTO), Tail Board, and documentation that is necessary to support wind turbine maintenance safely. This team member will also conduct inspections of equipment, tools, and facilities for compliance with EDPR policies, governmental safety guidelines, and environmental regulations. The ideal candidate is seeking an opportunity to showcase their knowledge and skills in a dynamic team setting with a passion for renewable energy as EDPR is changing tomorrow now!<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind plant equipment including substation and tower switchgear<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job-appropriate processes and procedures and communicate through appropriate channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify gaps in safety standards and safety risks in the environment, implement effective risk mitigation and provide recommendations to higher-level technical staff and management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Demonstrate and promote integrity, strong initiative, and teamwork<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs and act as a safety role model<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with and respond to EDPRs Remote Operations Control Center when necessary to coordinate remote operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Complete all required training in a satisfactory manner and timeframe<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in on-the-job training with on-site personnel<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Document all work performed using computer-based service reporting procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Adhere to internal controls in effect<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>Up to 10%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>High school diploma or GED<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Must possess a valid driver’s license and be able to operate a motor vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Effective Communicator<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Mechanical and electrical aptitude<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Troubleshooting and analysis skills.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Preferred: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Technical school education; or an equivalent Plant Technician I is responsible for the on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of equipment at one of EDPR NA’s operating wind-energy generation sites. You will work in all areas of plant operations as directed by the Operations Manager and will work closely with external contractors, Central Maintenance, Performance Analysis, and other internal departments as needed.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to learn and ensure proper operation, inspection, and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind plant equipment and systems including substations, met towers, tower switchgear, SCADA systems, road maintenance, crop damage assessments, general building maintenance, etc.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job appropriate processes and procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Effectively gather information regarding performance issues associated with turbines, met towers, metering, etc. May diagnose, recommend, and implement solutions up to intermediate routine issues.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Act as a safety role model by encouraging and recognizing others completing safe acts and intervening when unsafe acts are being practiced<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform a variety of administrative duties satisfying both internal and external reporting requirements. Administrative responsibilities include but are not limited to plan of the day (POD) reports, reviewing work orders, SAP processing, fault reports, offline turbine reports, QA\u002FQC inspection reports, and engineering cases.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify gaps in safety standards and safety risks in the work environment and provide recommendations to higher-level technical staff and management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Demonstrate and promote integrity, strong initiative, and a no-compromise focus on safety and quality of work on a continuous basis<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Review completed service checklists for accuracy and maintain punch list for future work activities<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Adhere to effective internal controls<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform data collection and prepare reports in order to meet reporting requirements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform QA\u002FQC inspections in accordance with applicable SOP<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Engage appropriate internal and external resources to correct performance issues<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to learn and ensure that reliable electronic communication is maintained between the turbines, substations, site office, and home office<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Facilitate periodic equipment inspections and reporting<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Monitor contractor performance to ensure quality and adherence to the highest standards and work practices<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Interface with local community members and landowners to establish and maintain rapport<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>as needed<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>1+ years of college or technical school education, or an equivalent combination of training and experience<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1 – 3 years of relevant experience in wind energy or a related industry<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office software, SQL Server software, facility management, and reporting systems<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with power plant operations and maintenance, wind plant operations, and turbines, high-voltage switching, post-operational repair, and maintenance of turbines preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in Analytical Problem Solving, Strong Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise. (Preferred)<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to operate a motor vehicle and possession of a valid driver’s license<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to work around low, medium and high-voltage equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to travel occasionally to other operational sites within the US and Canada as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to work overtime on holidays and weekends and to work on short notice as needed due to on-call scheduling<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to respond to site emergencies 24 hours a day, 7 days a week as needed<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently perform physical tasks including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching approximately 25% of the time while on wind farm sites. Ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment.<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Walking: <\u002Fb>Ability to walk across unpaved and rough surfaces when on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or scheduled form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Lifting: <\u002Fb>Ability to lift items weighing up to 60 pounds<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Climbing: <\u002Fb>\n      <ul>\n       <li>Ability to climb turbine ladders in excess of 100 meters in height<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Weight, including harness and tools, must be in accordance with the weight limit as specified by the ANSI Fall Protection Standards<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n     <li><b>Vision\u002FHearing: <\u002Fb>Ability to interpret and follow a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Tolerance to Extreme Weather Conditions: <\u002Fb>Ability to work in adverse weather conditions 25% of the time while on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Safety:<\u002Fb> Ability to understand and communicate safety precautions when necessary<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Travel
