<div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> This position is for the Operator II, level on the EDPR Heavy Assembly Lift Operations team (HALO). This position is for a person with the right skills to be trained in operating a self-hoisting crane and have the ability and experience to replace major components of a wind turbine. The position requires a comprehensive understanding and ability to apply your experience and education in all elements required for the successful large corrective crane operations. This includes, but is not limited to, completing Lock out Tag out (LOTO), Tail Board meetings, and job specific documentation that is required to conduct corrective maintenance in the safest manner possible. Perform inspections of equipment, tools, vehicles and rigging for compliance with EDPR policy and Governmental Safety and Environmental regulations. This person must be a self-motivated, self-starter and with a strong ability to recognize opportunities, take actions to achieve results, model and drive collaboration.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Support the HALO project manager with development of Standard Operating Procedures for heavy lift and self-hoisting crane to include, but not limited to: general crane works, transportation methods, component use inspection, field preparation plans and so on, in-line with Corporate Policies and Best-Known Practices;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>As requested by or in the absence of the Lead Operator: Supervise HALO team and project supplied workers;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the planning and coordination for all required maintenance of crane system and components in compliance with OEM warranty;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform major corrective replacements and repairs (gearbox, generator, rotor, main-shaft, blade) with self-hoisting crane. Confirm up tower components match workorder components and scope;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Train and instruct other technicians to perform crane and component replacement works;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform heavy rigging operations for component replacements;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure the crane schedule is accurate and up to date and work with the Project Manager to make any changes<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support troubleshooting for any turbine faults and\u002For Crane faults during the exchange process;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the Lead Operator in coordinating with the site manager(s): any site-specific requirements, point of contact, sign in, site logistics policy, muster points, site evacuation plan, area services and so on to ensure all safety, reporting, local municipal and regulatory requirements are met;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support with the establishment of the site communication plan and group. Communicate with the windfarm manager and HALO manager daily, prepare Plan Of the Day (POD) with, at minimum, text message updates on end of day (EOD) status;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage self-hoisting crane components to ensure longevity and ready to use condition always;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide the HALO Lead and windfarm manager any punch list items to ensure proper follow up of any pending issues following exchange works;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure that onsite work creates minimum impact to surrounding environment. Minimize the work extending beyond existing roads and tower pads;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>As needed, confirm and communicate with the Central Maintenance team for component deliveries and preparedness;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Complete necessary forms and reports regarding maintenance work as requested by the Company, including SAP entries and other;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Oversee effective consumable and necessary crane &amp; turbine parts inventory management to include initiation or continuance of inventory stock and issuance system for spare parts and defective parts control and communication. This includes necessary “support” parts to complete component exchanges and crane equipment;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure that scheduled field work for the WTG is in the best interest of the Turbine condition and Energy Based Availability;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Protect Company confidential information by not communicating, disclosing, or using for benefit of third parties and maintain the highest degree of honesty and integrity always;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Operate Semi-Truck &amp; Trailer, comply with all DOT requirements and all state &amp; local requirements\u002Frestrictions;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the planning and coordination for all required maintenance and cleaning of:<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Crane system and components<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Semi-tractor and trailers<\u002Fli> \n     <li>And, perform such other duties as may be required from time to time by the company.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Participate in proactive team efforts to achieve departmental and company goals.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Contribute to building a positive team spirit.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Communicate effectively with all levels of employees.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Protect confidential information by not communicating, disclosing to, or using for benefit of third parties.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain the highest degree of honesty and integrity at all times.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Interface with local windfarm management and staff.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Must maintain a valid commercial driver’s license.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain company vehicle(s).<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Respond to turbine component emergencies from time to time.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Travel ~80% with home rotation time depending on current assignment.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Agrees to obtain all required certifications and training to perform the job, as provided by and deemed necessary by EDPR.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Responsibly manage corporate expenses and expense reports in a timely manner.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>TOOLS AND EQUIPMENT EXPERIENCE \u002F KNOWLEDGE<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Crane &amp; Rigging<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Motor vehicle \n      <ul>\n       <li>Automobile<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Semi-truck and trailer<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n     <li>Hand tools (wrenches, screw drivers, hammers, pliers)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Multi-meter<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Mega Ohm meter<\u002Fli> \n     <li>WTG hoist and safety systems<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Personal Protective Equipment, Lad-safe device, harness, lanyards<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Forklift<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Hydraulic torque equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Must be able to successfully obtain Major Component Replacement Credentials through the internal Task Based Certification (TBC) program<\u002Fli> \n     <li>LIFTRA experience<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EDUCATION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>To perform this job successfully, an individual must demonstrate they can perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and\u002For ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Education and\u002For Experience: Minimum education requirement is Associates Degree and at least (8) years related experience and\u002For training; or equivalent combination of education and experience in operations and major wind turbine component replacement.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Basic Electricity Experience: Understanding of Ohms Law, the difference and use of AC and DC currents, circuit testing with multi-meter and its fundamentals.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Medium Voltage: Understanding switch gear, pad mount transformer, step-down transformer termination and basic safety.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Language Skills: Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Interpersonal Skills: The ability to lead a team, set achievable goals, monitor performance, coach, resolve differences, identify strengths and weaknesses to better train and manage the team.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Mathematical Skills: Ability to work with and apply mathematical concepts, to include fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Capacity \u002F Proactivity to perform lifting riggings and implementations in main components in order to simplify or facilitate hoisting operation with Self-hoisting device through maneuvers as simplified and safe as possible.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Reasoning Ability: Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Creativity: Ability to imagine the process to anticipate. The ability to see around corners, find new alternatives and options to increase safety and work efficiency.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>COMPUTER SKILLS:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Knowledge of database, project management, spreadsheet and word processing software, electronic mail, graphics, technical diagrams, flow charts, etc.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Understanding of Microsoft products and\u002For complementing products preferred.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in Analytical Problem Solving, Strong Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise preferred<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to loud. Hearing protection may be recommended and\u002For required in some areas.<\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li> <b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility<\u002Fb>: Ability to frequently perform physical tasks including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching approximately 75% of the time while on wind farm sites; ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment.<\u002Fli> \n     <li> <b>Walking<\u002Fb>: Ability to walk .25 to .5 miles per day, including across unpaved and rough surfaces when on wind farm sites.<\u002Fli> \n     <li> <b>Speech\u002FReading<\u002Fb>: Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form.<\u002Fli> \n     <li> <b>Lifting:<\u002Fb> Ability to frequently lift items weighing up to 60 pounds and to occasionally lift items weighing between 60 and 100 pounds.<\u002Fli> \n     <li> <b>Climbing:<\u002Fb> Ability to climb turbine towers up to 95 meters in height approximately 5-10 times per week, or as needed. Weight, including harness and tools, must be in accordance with the weight limit as specified by the ANSI Fall Protection Standards.<\u002Fli> \n     <li> <b>Vision\u002FHearing<\u002Fb>: Ability to interpret and follow a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form.<\u002Fli> \n     <li> <b>Tolerance to Extreme Weather Conditions<\u002Fb>: Ability to work in adverse weather conditions 35% of the time while on wind farm sites.<\u002Fli> \n     <li> <b>DOT<\u002Fb>: Annual physical and other requirements, as required by state or federal law.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Travel Required<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Yes. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Mechanical Inspector will provide oversight for the construction of solar projects’ mechanical components in accordance with plan specifications and departmental guidelines in order to ensure that requirements regarding schedule, cost, and quality are met. This is a 12-month temporary assignment with full benefits. 100% travel, per diem, 3 weeks on 1 week off rotational assignments<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Provide support to the Quality Assurance Inspector to ensure that the tracker system, including piles, torque tubes, and modules are installed in accordance with the projects mechanical design documents and suppliers' installation manual<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide oversight to ensure that the execution of work is in compliance with approved contracts<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Monitor the execution and implementation of the project schedule<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop effective relationships with contractors, suppliers, landowners, and the local community<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain a thorough understanding of all project documents<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Review plans and procedures periodically and institute changes when necessary<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop and foster a spirit of project team effort<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure that contractors abide by their own QA\u002FQC plans<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide support in reviewing all contractor-supplied QA\u002FQC documentation for completeness<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify critical issues and make recommendations to the Project Manager<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Review and comment on contractors’ schedules<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide assistance to the project team in meeting the overall project objectives<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Oversee contractors’ mechanical construction installation and commissioning work<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Prepare daily reports outlining progress of the work<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure that the company’s safety, quality, schedule, and cost objectives are achieved<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide input regarding the project design process<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain effective lines of communication with all company personnel responsible for the project along with all general contractors and sub-contractors<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support development of the mechanical construction portions of EPC contracts and exhibits<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports:<\u002Fb> None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> Up to 20%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>High School diploma or equivalent<\u002Fli> \n     <li>5 years in the power industry<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Thorough knowledge of mechanical engineering, mathematics, construction, mechanical construction standards, and codes<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Understanding of Microsoft Products, Procore management Program and\u002For complementing products preferred.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in Analytical Problem Solving, Strong Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise preferred<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b> <\u002Fb><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to comprehend all construction documents including blueprints and drawings<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to exhibit a professional demeanor to customers and other employees<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Visual acuity including sufficient depth perception, color recognition, and field of vision necessary to perform visual inspections, work with small parts, and take accurate measurements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong problem-solving, statistical, and analytical skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Verbal and written communication and presentation skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to be self-motivated<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b> <\u002Fb><b>Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently perform physical tasks including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching approximately 75% of the time while on solar farm construction sites. Ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment.<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Walking: <\u002Fb>Ability to walk .25 to .5 miles per day, including across unpaved and rough surfaces when on solar farm construction sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Lifting: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently lift items weighing up to 60 pounds and to occasionally lift items weighing between 60 and 100 pounds<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Vision\u002FHearing: <\u002Fb>Ability to interpret and follow a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Tolerance to Extreme Weather Conditions: <\u002Fb>Ability to work in adverse weather conditions 25% of the time while on solar farm construction sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Safety:<\u002Fb> Ability to understand and communicate safety precautions when necessary<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Qualifications<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Experience<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>Required<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       5 years in the power industry \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Equal Opportunity Employer\u002FProtected Veterans\u002FIndividuals with Disabilities<\u002Fp> \n   <p>The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.  <p> The Services and Materials Procurement Manager are responsible for identifying, developing, implementing, and maintaining tools and procedures for the procurement of construction and engineering services in support of the EPC and for the purchasing of various pieces of project equipment. This position will be on a hybrid work schedule, working three days in the office and two days at home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Create, implement, and manage a competitive bid process for all services\u002Fequipment required by EDPR NA<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop contracting strategies and processes for tendering Requests for Proposals, reviewing and leveling vendor proposals, and negotiating contracts that result in the best value possible<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Serve as a liaison between the Procurement, Construction, Engineering, and Operations departments<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop and manage purchasing plans and strategies relating to construction of the company’s wind farms and solar parks<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Interface with vendors during the Request for Proposal process<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain responsibility for bid evaluations, commercial and contractual negotiations, and contract approval prior to contract finalization<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Create a competitive bid process that can be used at all levels of the organization<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with the training of personnel in negotiations and contract management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Oversee the development of standardized processes and templates for all contracting efforts<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Supervise the work of Contracts Analysts and Contracts Associates<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>3-4<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>10-20%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Finance, or a related field; <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Exciting entry-level position, the Field Service Technician I (Wind Tech) is an essential member of the Wind or Solar Farm that is responsible for the on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of equipment at one of EDPR NA’s wind-energy generation sites. Tasks include but are not limited to completing Lock-Out-Tag-Out (LOTO), Tail Board, and documentation that is necessary to support wind turbine maintenance safely. This team member will also conduct inspections of equipment, tools, and facilities for compliance with EDPR policies, governmental safety guidelines, and environmental regulations. The ideal candidate is seeking an opportunity to showcase their knowledge and skills in a dynamic team setting with a passion for renewable energy as EDPR is changing tomorrow now!<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind plant equipment including substation and tower switchgear<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job-appropriate processes and procedures and communicate through appropriate channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify gaps in safety standards and safety risks in the environment, implement effective risk mitigation and provide recommendations to higher-level technical staff and management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Demonstrate and promote integrity, strong initiative, and teamwork<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs and act as a safety role model<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with and respond to EDPRs Remote Operations Control Center when necessary to coordinate remote operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Complete all required training in a satisfactory manner and timeframe<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in on-the-job training with on-site personnel<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Document all work performed using computer-based service reporting procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Adhere to internal controls in effect<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>Up to 10%<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>High school diploma or GED<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Must possess a valid driver’s license and be able to operate a motor vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Effective Communicator<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Mechanical and electrical aptitude<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Troubleshooting and analysis skills.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Preferred: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Technical school education; or an equivalent combination of training and experience.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1 – 2 years relevant experience in wind energy or a related industry.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Understanding of Microsoft products and\u002For complementing products.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong analytical Problem Solving, Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with power plant operations and maintenance, wind plant operations and turbines (including turbine power converters specifically), high voltage switching, and post-operational repair and maintenance of turbines.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Familiarity with maintenance and electronic testing equipment (e.g., voltage testers, amp clamps, hydraulic torque equipment, alignment tools, various hand, and power tools) and with heavy equipment required for facility maintenance including working knowledge of crane and rigging requirements.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge SQL Server software, facility management and reporting systems, and computerized diagnostic and <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>The Associate Director of Project Management will provide leadership for a rolling portfolio of projects and mitigate potential risk at the direction of the Director of Project Management. This position will assist in providing tactical leadership for project management and project controls including scheduling, budgeting, and supervising project-related activities. Additional responsibilities will include assisting with the development of strategic project objectives and providing direction for projects by working with the Director of Development and Development Project Managers and other members of the Development team on mid-stage development key task objectives, pre-engineering, and constructability reviews, driving procurement of long-lead equipment, and in helping to direct the construction contracting strategy. It is also important to ensure that safety, quality, cost, environmental issues, landowner expectations, and legal requirements are achieved or exceeded while accomplishing project objectives.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Assist in providing strategic leadership for projects from mid-stage development through the final development phase, approximately 12 – 18 months before the start of construction at the direction of the Director of Project Management, and in working with the Director of Development and Development Project Managers to accomplish key task and development objectives<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist in managing the integration of development and construction execution functions for committed projects<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist in the preparation and maintenance of detailed project execution strategies including construction plans, schedules, and budgets<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Understand the implications of variance technical options and help guide engineering designs to achieve the best solution for each situation<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the balance-of-plant process, preparation of turbine installation bid documents, and the Request for Proposal process<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with the negotiation of construction contracts<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist Director of Project Management during project construction activities to ensure safety, quality, schedule, cost, environmental, landowner, and other project requirements are met or exceeded<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Help to ensure the execution of work in accordance with contracts and policies<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist in planning and hiring of competent field staff in order to ensure adequate resources are in place for effective and timely execution of committed projects<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop effective relationships with internal departments, contractors, suppliers, landowners, and other stakeholders<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support and solicit input from staff at all levels of the organization<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Establish effective and supportive relationships with colleagues<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Reinforce a team approach throughout the enterprise both on projects and internal initiatives<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Effectively communicate relevant information to superiors<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Champion change and effectively manage the implementation of new ideas<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>1<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Finance, Political Science, Geography\u002FLand Management or Construction Management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Master's of Business Administration is preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>5-10 years in the power industry in project development, contract negotiation, industrial construction, or capital project management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Advanced knowledge of project development, construction management, and constructing methods for large projects, contract management, procurement and supply chain management, environmental and building permits, and transportation logistics<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Strong leadership and team-building skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to be self-motivated and willingness to take initiative<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong organizational commitment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Exemplary standards of integrity, honor, safety, management, ethics, quality, and productivity<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical Demands &amp; Working Conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Lifting: <\u002Fb>Ability to lift items weighing up to 20 pounds<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Vision\u002FHearing: <\u002Fb>Ability to understand a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Safety:<\u002Fb> Ability to understand and communicate safety precautions when necessary<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Intermediate level position, the Wind Technician II is an integral member of the Wind Site with the responsibility of on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of equipment at one of EDPR NA’s operating wind energy generation sites. Tasks include but are not limited to completing Lock-Out-Tag-Out (LOTO), Tail Board, and documentation that is necessary to support wind turbine maintenance safely. This team member will also conduct inspections of equipment, tools, and facilities for compliance with EDPR policies, governmental safety guidelines, and environmental regulations. The ideal candidate is experienced in renewable energy or related industry and is prepared to further their career as part of a global leader in the renewable energy sector.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind plant equipment, including substation and tower switchgear<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job appropriate processes and procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Communicate through appropriate channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Seek assistance when encountering turbine issues outside the trained skill level to ensure success in the resolution<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs and act as a safety role model<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Demonstrate and promote integrity and strong initiative<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform data collection and prepare reports in order to meet reporting requirements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with and respond to EDPRs Remote Operations Control Center when necessary to coordinate remote operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform QA\u002FQC inspections in accordance with applicable SOP<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Facilitate periodic equipment inspections and reporting<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Document all work performed using computer-based service reporting procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Complete all required training in a satisfactory manner and timeframe<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Adhere to internal controls in effect<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports:<\u002Fb> None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> up to 10%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Must possess a valid driver’s license and be able to operate a motor vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1+ years of college or technical school education, or an equivalent combination of training and experience.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>2 – 5 years of relevant experience in wind energy or a related industry.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of MS Office software, SQL server software, facility management and reporting systems, and computerized diagnostics and troubleshooting tools<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Familiarity with maintenance and electronic testing equipment (e.g., voltage testers, amp clamps, oscilloscopes, megohmmeters, infrared testers, hydraulic torque equipment, alignment tools, various hand and power tools, and heavy equipment required for facility maintenance)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Working knowledge of crane and rigging requirements<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Preferred: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Understanding of Microsoft products and\u002For complementing products.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in Analytical Problem Solving, Strong Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with power plant operations and maintenance, wind plant operations and turbines (including turbine power converters specifically), high voltage switching, and post-operational repair and maintenance of turbines.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to work around low- and medium-voltage equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Practical problem-solving skills and ability to handle a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Willingness to travel occasionally to other operational sites within the US as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to work overtime on holidays and weekends and to work on short notice as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to respond to site emergencies 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, as needed<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently perform physical tasks including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching approximately 75% of the time while on wind farm sites; ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Walking: <\u002Fb>Ability to walk .25 to .5 miles per day, including across unpaved and rough surfaces when on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or scheduled form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Lifting: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently lift items weighing up to 50 pounds<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Climbing:<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Ability to climb turbine towers in excess of 100 meters in height to access the work area<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Weight, including harness and tools, must be in accordance with the weight limit as specified by the ANSI Fall Protection Standards<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n Project Developer will provide project management assistance and task management supporting the development of renewable energy (wind and solar) projects from site identification through construction. This is a fast-paced and multi-faceted role facing multiple internal and external stakeholders and provides immediate exposure to commercial matters.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Identify and organize the development of wind and solar projects by creating and updating project maps and databases using GIS tools<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Represent EDPRNA in the field, working with Project Managers and landowners to create and amend agreements, options, leases, and land sales<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with community outreach and other stakeholder management activities<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Conduct land, market, regulatory, and related project research<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Compile documentation, attend meetings, conduct necessary studies, and perform other tasks as needed to obtain permits for solar projects at the local, state, and federal level<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with efforts to secure transmission and interconnection rights from utilities and transmission providers<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in the preparation of proposals that are submitted to power purchasers including utilities, community choice aggregators, and commercial &amp; industrial customers<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support internal reporting and project tracking efforts<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> up to 65%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Environmental Sciences, or a related field<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1 – 2 years of progressively responsible project management or development experience in energy or a related industry<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong knowledge of ESRI ArcGIS and Google Earth software preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office software with strong Excel skills<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Strong organizational and time-management skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>High attention to detail<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to work productively with limited supervision<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong interest in renewable energy<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to travel and work overtime as needed<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical demands &amp; <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Exciting early-career leadership role at the cutting edge of the renewable energy industry. This is a fast-paced, dynamic position at the center of project management and renewable energy development across the eastern United States. The PM1 is responsible for handling complex tasks and supporting a senior manager on multiple winds, solar, and battery storage projects. The PM1 takes ownership of projects from early-stage site identification all the way through permitting and construction. The Project Manager I synchronize the efforts of internal project teams, which are comprised of highly experienced experts in every domain of the utility-scale renewable energy industry. The PM1 interacts daily with a diversity of external landowners, community stakeholders, and public officials in various project areas. Internal and external stakeholders regard the PM1 as a primary point of contact for a project. This is a terrific early-career position for leaders seeking professional growth opportunities in the renewable energy industry. Positions open in Indianapolis on a hybrid schedule.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Cover letters are strongly recommended.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Related Positions, for reference (with average relevant years of experience):<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Project Coordinator (0-1 yrs)<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Project Developer (1-2 yrs)<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Project Manager 1 (2-3 yrs)<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Project Manager 2 (4-5 yrs)<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Responsible for local state, federal, and regional permitting of wind\u002Fsolar farms<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Oversee the preparation of proposals that are submitted to utilities<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Obtain land surface rights to design, permit, construct, operate, and maintain wind\u002Fsolar power projects<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Identify prospective projects with suitable wind\u002Fsolar resource, electric transmission access, and site characteristics<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Establish and manage relationships with stakeholders, including elected officials, regulators, utilities, RTOs, and community leaders, to support project development<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in policy outreach efforts to government officials regarding wind\u002Fsolar industry issues<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Monitor Generation Interconnection studies performed by transmission providers and third parties<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage the environmental study and permitting process<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the financial analysis and modeling of the project<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage project level expenditures and invoice processing<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop project budgets<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in interconnection agreement negotiations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with internal resources, such as the Legal, Engineering, Construction, Finance, Investment Analysis, and Energy Assessment teams<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide reports to management by producing regular and frequent pipeline updates, project status updates, and other reporting documents<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Research the energy market and competition on an ongoing basis<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Communicate information continuously and effectively to cross-functional team<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Negotiate and establish local agreements that address tax abatement, Road Use, and Decommissioning<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> up to 65%. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> A Land Contract Coordinator I is responsible for reviewing and processing land documents, payment due date calculations, routine LPM data maintenance and reporting and other duties related to EDPRNA wind, solar and other projects. Provides backup for document scanning and uploading to the electronic Project Vault and\u002For Land Package Process application as needed. Serve as liaison between EDPRNA’s Development, Legal, Accounting, Asset Management, and Operations departments in all land-related matters. This position will be on a hybrid work schedule, working three days in the office and two days at home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Confirm new agreements and payment requests conform with audit requirements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Process land agreements (e.g., met\u002Fsodar licenses, lease options, rights of entry, ) validating that data in land system is accurate and complete, adjusting LPM data as needed; includes verification of payment requests and audit justification<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Payment review and update as required<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with preparation of payment calculation spreadsheets<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Process electronic land data submissions; review for proper naming conventions before uploading to electronic Project Vault and\u002For LPM<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Immediate scanning, uploading and LPM data entry on priority project documents to electronic Project Vault and LPM database<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Create new LPM templates; requires analysis of new master agreement document provided by Legal<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Preparation of landowner copy mailouts<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Link land documents in LPM database as directed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Process routine change of address forms<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Review and process ACH letter amendments<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Resources Management:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> PEOPLE: <\u002Fb>0 Direct Reports<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Expenses: <\u002Fb>0<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum Qualification:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Education: <\u002Fb>Bachelor’s degree or higher preferred; its affiliates, and its subsidiaries develop, construct, own, and operate wind farms and solar parks throughout North America. Headquartered in Houston, Texas, with 58 wind farms, nine solar parks, and eight regional offices across North America, EDPR NA has developed more than 8,800 megawatts (MW) and operates more than 8,200 MW of onshore utility-scale renewable energy projects. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p> In strengthening its crucial role in the energy transition, EDP Renováveis (EDPR) has created a new business unit dedicated to the development of energy storage technologies. This unit will focus on the analysis of storage technology and is another step in EDP's commitment to innovation in clean energy generation.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> The main responsibility for the Storage Procurement Manager is to ensure that all the activities relating to the procurement of services and equipment for the storage projects are carried out in an adequate, timely and compliant manner across all the geographies. Typical procurement processes will relate to engineering related services, EPC contracting, supervision services, commissioning services, H&amp;S services, consulting services and equipment purchase.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Storage Procurement Manager will have a direct responsibility in implementing and managing all the administrative\u002Fcontractual aspects of the procurement processes and in ensuring full compliance of these processes with EDPR’s policies and with regulatory and legal obligations.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Moreover, the Storage Procurement Manager will develop a pivotal role in supporting and bringing together other procurement stakeholders, namely but not exclusively:<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>each project’s project manager, for coordinating all activities to ensure its delivery in acceptable conditions of cost, time, and technical and legal compliance.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>EDPR technical department, namely on what concerns procurement to establish the technical standards to be used by the project, to qualify suppliers, to write technical conditions for specific bidding processes, to answer technical queries by bidders and to participate in the analysis, evaluation and recommendation of the technical part of the bids;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>EDP and EDPR’s compliance and legal departments.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>legal advisers supporting the procurement processes.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Responsible for the full cycle of RFPs for services and for materials and equipment:<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Transversal coordination of all the departments involved in the preparation of the strategy of the RFPs. Liaise with end users to develop and review technical scope\u002Fcommercial packages for competitive tender events.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Challenge scope specifications to determine where unnecessary costs can be eliminated, and more value can be achieved. Moreover, analyse the technical assessment to assure a homogenized scope for the different bids and review different alternative proposed by the suppliers to improve scope\u002Fprice.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>RFP Management: Receive, analyse, compare bids and prepare commercial and contractual report.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Responsible for negotiation of terms and conditions, complying with legislation, ethical practices, EDPR procurement policies and tender requirements<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Modify and adapt the EDPR contract template to each service\u002Fsupply to be contracted in accordance with the project specification, constrains and contracting strategy.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure that all purchase orders and contracts are placed in accordance with defined business processes<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Development of contracting strategies and processes to meet business goals and EDPR objectives.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Establish a deep understanding of the market for the services, materials and equipment required.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Support definition and execution of procurement transversal activities as procurement intel or suppliers’ qualification.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Manage relationships with vendors including but not limited to identifying new market entrants to create additional competitiveness and market tension for the foreseen services\u002Fsupplies to be contracted. Keep up to date the supplier’s data base by categories.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Coordinate the technical due diligence process among different vendors, tracking the Storage market and monitor technological advances in the industry.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Benchmark internally against comparable purchasing initiatives from the company’s projects portfolio.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Additional duties as required.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> RESOURCES MANAGEMENT<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> PEOPLE:<\u002Fb> 0 direct reports<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> EXPENSES: <\u002Fb>N\u002FA<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> REQUIREMENTS<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> ACADEMIC SKILLS: <\u002Fb>University Degree in engineering<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE: <\u002Fb>At least 5 years of relevant experience in industrial and project procurement activities, namely in similar industries (energy, chemical, process), including experience in negotiation and involvement in the management of the commercial, legal and compliance aspects of the procurement processes. Specific experience in storage projects will be considered a plus. Experience in working in multidisciplinary project teams and dealing with external stakeholders (e.g., contractors, technology providers, authorities, clients, etc.) will also be considered a plus.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> LANGUAGES: <\u002Fb>Fluent in English and Spanish or Portuguese<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> TRAVELLING FLEXIBILITY: <\u002Fb>Availability for occasional travelling<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> OTHERS:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Strong problem-solving aptitudes<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong negotiation skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong teamwork skills in a multicultural environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong communication skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Excellent organizational skills including ability to organize and maintain a fluid administrative process.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to manage significant amount of interaction with key stakeholders throughout the company including executive level leadership.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Strong technical and commercial analytical and quantitative skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong business acumen and demonstrated project management skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to quickly come up to speed on all technical and commercial subjects related to Storage projects through the full development life cycle and transition to construction and operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal, and teamwork skills<\u002Fli> issues and renewable energy<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Qualifications<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <p> The Associate Director of Business Development &amp; Strategy explores, identifies, analyses, and executes onshore renewable asset opportunities- wind, solar, and storage. He or she will also analyze partnerships to develop, own and build these projects across North America. This position will be on a hybrid remote work schedule, working three days in the office and two days from home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Identify and analyze different markets and opportunities in coordination with the CEO, Executive Vice Presidents (EVP), and Directors for the respected business areas, assessing attractiveness and priority.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Working closely with senior leadership, transmission, commercial origination, and M&amp;A to evaluate appropriate M&amp;A opportunities<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the anticipation or identification of prospective markets with attractive potential for onshore wind and solar development.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Obtaining market intel on M&amp;A opportunities proposes different strategies for business development, including greenfield options when applicable.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop lines of organic growth through agreements with technology providers, local partners, developers, investors, and other external parties.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Liaison and contract developers, banks, and other sources of projects in coordination with Investments, Mergers and Acquisition team members.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Communicate effectively with team members and colleagues to ensure consistency in the development activities within the organization.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Research market and competition on an ongoing basis to identify best practices and improvement opportunities.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Engaging with counterparties and helping manage and maintain relationships across the renewable sector.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>As needed; accounting for corporate-level activities, including general and administrative (G&amp;A) expenses, intercompany expenses, project development costs, fixed assets, and inventory and cash activities. This position will be on a hybrid remote work schedule, working three days in office and two days from home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Maintain system of intercompany invoicing and payments<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain accounting records for internal procurement function<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain parts inventory system<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with accounting for projects in development<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Record and analyze corporate financial transactions in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Record fixed assets and depreciation of EDP and EDPR Corporate<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Prepare reconciliations to properly support account balances<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Prepare required consolidating and eliminating journal entries<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform analyses of financial statement variances<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain chart of accounts<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain relevant data in SAP system<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor’s degree in Accounting<\u002Fli> \n     <li>3+ years of relevant experience; (PV\u002Fwind) + storage and stand-alone storage projects globally for all EDPR regions (NA, EU, LatAm, APAC), coordinating the local teams, in order to ensure the minimization of costs, compliance with deadlines and specifications and standards requirements contributing to optimize the projects and their future commercial operation.<b> A<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <div> \n     <ul>\n      <li><b>DEVELOPMENT ENGINEERING: <\u002Fb>Lead and manage the overall conceptual design, basic or building projects, as well as the needed field studies or external projects assessment support during the development phase of the projects of utility-scale energy storage systems and hybrid assets. Collaborate and give technical support in matters related to the connection to the electricity network and regulation capabilities of the storage plant, ensuring its compliance with the local regulations and DSO\u002FTSO standards in order to optimize the designs in efficiency while maximizing the technical guarantees. Coordinate and supervise the realization of the budgets of the material execution of the projects, and the control of such costs along with the project execution.<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful> \n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <p>2. <b>PROJECT TENDERS<\u002Fb>: Lead and assist with the development of key contracting strategies, terms, and implementation of energy storage systems. Coordinate the preparation of technical specifications relating to energy storage systems that may be used in EPC agreements and competitive bids. Provide strategic leadership as well as technical support to the Procurement team for the preparation and execution of RFI’s and RFP’s for vendors and contractors. Support teams throughout the development, contracts, RFP’s, contracting, and negotiations of energy storage execution projects. Review and evaluate technical aspects of EPC bidder’s proposals pertaining to energy storage during the course of EPC selection with a tabulation of the received bids in order to ensure the selection of the best final project from the engineering point of view.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> 3. <b>CONSTRUCTION ENGINEERING:<\u002Fb> Lead and manage the team in the simultaneous realization of all the detailed engineering for projects construction, have a direct perception of the projects, assisting the team when necessary. Support value-engineering approach when designing energy storage systems in multiple project-specific use cases.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> 4. <b>COORDINATION OF PROJECT TRANSFER FROM ENGINEERING TO CONSTRUCTION AND FINALLY TO OPERATIONS<\u002Fb>: Lead the transfer of projects to the Construction Team to optimize the construction, start times, guaranteeing the coordination and technical quality in the transfer of the project. Coordinate the evaluation and resolution of the proposed modifications of the final construction project raised in the construction phase, concluding the learned lessons from the project in order to ensure the maintenance of the technical standards of EDPR.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> 5. <b>CONSTRUCTION SUPPORT: <\u002Fb>Support Construction and rest of Plant Engineering teams during the execution of energy storage projects.<br> <br> 6. <b>TEAM MANAGEMENT:<\u002Fb> Direction and leadership of the multinational team in charge across all EDPR regions (NA, Europe, LatAm, APAC), set goals, objectives and responsibilities, define indicators of measurement and evaluation of results, stimulate and motivate people.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> 7. <b>TRANSVERSAL SUPPORT:<\u002Fb> Communicate information continuously and effectively to cross-functional teams, collaborate closely with various departments including Development, Origination, Procurement, Finance, Energy Assessment, Engineering, and Construction to conduct technical planning and due diligence evaluations. Lead the development and provisioning of cost inputs to CapEx and OpEx models utilizing current industry contacts and intelligence from the industry. Maintain and develop key strategic relationships with major vendors, suppliers, and contractors throughout the energy storage industry.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> 8. <b>STANDARDIZATION: <\u002Fb>Lead the application of the common standards in the projects, supervising its adaptation to applicable local regulations, in order to avoid non-justified deviations and maximize the investment efficiency with all the technical warranty needed. Lead the team in the engineering best practices definition and implementation. Challenge Technical Standard’s applicability and verify and justify deviations from them, in order to ensure the technical solvency and the technical-economic efficiency of the projects. Initiate and develop creative and innovative engineering processes. Assist the E&amp;C standardization team with the development of technical specifications, vendor reviews, supplier qualifications, etc, including testing and commissioning aspects of energy storage projects.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> 9. <b>TECHNOLOGY SUPPORT COORDINATION<\u002Fb>: Ensure the coordination of service provision from BESS Technology and other Technology teams to the Storage Engineering Team, of specific key studies and technological intel needed during the engineering phase for its integration in the project, to minimize the risk associated with the construction process.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> 11. <b>COMPANY POLICY AND LEGAL COMPLIANCE:<\u002Fb> Understand and apply policies to prevent occupational hazards, environment, and quality to ensure implementation and compliance on tasks under their responsibility.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> 12. <b>EDPR INSTITUTIONAL REPRESENTATION:<\u002Fb> Represent EDPR to agencies and institutions, public and private, in matters relating to its jurisdiction to enforce the interests of EDPR.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><b> Educational Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Master’s degree in Engineering from an accredited educational institution. A postgraduate will be valued.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><b>Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>8-10 years combined of technical\u002Fengineering and management experience in the energy storage industry·<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience in energy storage designs required (specifically chemical battery-based technologies).<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Knowledge of contracting EPC’s regarding energy storage projects (performance requirements, warranties, LD’s, etc).<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Knowledge of Energy Storage costs (equipment and installation) for estimating large capital projects.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong knowledge of Solar PV technology and engineering is preferred.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of the full Microsoft Office suite; high proficiency in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint required.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Knowledge of engineering and market economics and design optimization.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong existing relationships and familiarity with energy storage equipment vendors are required.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Knowledge of International technical normative<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Spanish, Portuguese, and others are a plus<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to lead a multi-national team, with persons in different countries and labor calendar<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong technical, analytical, quantitative, strategic, and management skills.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to quickly come up to speed on all technical and commercial subjects related to renewable energy projects.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to quickly understand the basics of a variety of subjects relating to renewable energy, including civil and electrical engineering designs and detailed drawings, construction-related processes, environmental, and cultural studies.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong organizational skills and high attention to detail.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong written and verbal communication, interpersonal, and teamwork skills.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to work productively with limited supervision.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong time-management skills and ability to multi-task<\u002Fli> \n     <li> Strong interest in renewable energy and utility business<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Business acumen and demonstrated strong project management skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to travel<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b> Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb>Ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Lifting:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb>Ability to lift items weighing up to 10 pounds<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Vision\u002FHearing:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb>Ability to understand a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Safety:<\u002Fb> Ability to understand and communicate safety precautions when necessary<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Equal Opportunity Employer\u002FProtected Veterans\u002FIndividuals with Disabilities<\u002Fp> \n   <p>The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>Summary<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Requires a comprehensive understanding and ability to apply your experience and education in all elements required for the successful large corrective crane operations. This includes, but is not limited to, completing Lock out Tag out (LOTO), Tail Board meetings, and job specific documentation that is required to conduct corrective maintenance in the safest manner possible. Perform inspections of equipment, tools, vehicles and rigging for compliance with EDPR policy and Governmental Safety and Environmental regulations. This person must be a self-motivated, self-starter and with a strong ability to anticipate next steps.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Essential Duties, Work Activities &amp; responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><i>Support the HALO project manager in developing the HALO operating program; <\u002Fi><\u002Fli>\n     <li><i>Support the HALO project manager with development of Standard Operating Procedures for heavy lift and self-hoisting crane to include, but not limited to: general crane works, transportation methods, component use inspection, field preparation plans and so on, in-line with Corporate Policies and Best-Known Practices;<\u002Fi><\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure the continued development of HALO team members, including windfarm supplied support members have their appropriate training and safety requirements and are maintained;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>As requested by or in the absence of the Project Manager: Supervise HALO team and project supplied workers;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the planning and coordination for all required maintenance of crane system and components in compliance with OEM warranty;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform major corrective replacements and repairs (gearbox, generator, rotor, main-shaft, blade) with self-hoisting crane. Confirm up tower components match work order components and scope;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Train and instruct other technicians to perform crane and component replacement works;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform heavy rigging operations for component replacements;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure the crane schedule is accurate and up to date and work with the Project Manager to make any changes<\u002Fli> \n     <li>for any turbine faults and\u002For Crane faults during the exchange process;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Confirm with windfarm manager(s): any site-specific requirements, point of contact, sign in, site logistics policy, muster points, site evacuation plan, area services and so on to ensure all safety, reporting, local municipal and regulatory requirements are met;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Establish site communication plan and group. Communicate with the windfarm manager and HALO manager daily, prepare Plan Of the Day (POD) with, at minimum, text message updates on end of day (EOD) status;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage self-hoisting crane components to ensure longevity and ready to use condition always;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide the HALO project manager and windfarm manager any punch list items to ensure proper follow up of any pending issues following exchange works;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure that onsite work creates minimum impact to surrounding environment. Minimize the work extending beyond existing roads and tower pads;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Confirm and communicate with the Central Maintenance team for component deliveries and preparedness;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Complete necessary forms and reports regarding maintenance work as requested by the Company, including SAP entries and other;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure that scheduled field work for the WTG is in the best interest of the Turbine condition and Energy Based Availability;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Protect Company confidential information by not communicating, disclosing, or using for benefit of third parties and maintain the highest degree of honesty and integrity always;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Operate Semi-Truck &amp; Trailer, comply with all DOT requirements and all state &amp; local requirements\u002Frestrictions;<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the planning and coordination for all required maintenance and cleaning of: \n      <ul>\n       <li>Crane system and components<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Semi-tractor and trailers<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n     <li>And, perform such other duties as may be required from time to time by the company.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> JOB CONTEXT<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The lead HALO member will confirm, and remedy team needs and ensure readiness to perform the day’s work. As the team-lead you will assign the day’s work, duties, goals and expectations for that day and the next, to ensure daily goals are met for continuous progress. Your day will typically be spent in the field leading the ground and up-tower works necessary to perform large component replacements. Daily works will be centered around doing what it takes to safely replace major components and crane operations. Stop work times are usually at breaking\u002Ftransition\u002Fmilestone points and can vary from day to day depending on safety and progress.<\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in proactive team efforts to achieve departmental and company goals.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Contribute to building a positive team spirit.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Communicate effectively with all levels of employees.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Protect confidential information by not communicating, disclosing to, or using for benefit of third parties.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain the highest degree of honesty and integrity at all times.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Interface with local windfarm management and staff.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Must maintain a valid commercial driver’s license.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain company vehicle(s).<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Respond to turbine component emergencies from time to time.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Travel ~80% with home rotation time depending on current assignment.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Agrees to obtain all required certifications and training to perform the job, as provided by and deemed necessary by EDPR.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Responsibly manage corporate expenses and expense reports in a timely manner.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> TOOLS AND EQUIPMENT EXPERIENCE \u002F KNOWLEDGE<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Crane &amp; Rigging<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Motor vehicle \n      <ul>\n       <li>Automobile<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Semi-truck and trailer<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n     <li>Hand tools (wrenches, screw drivers, hammers, pliers)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Multi-meter<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Mega Ohm meter<\u002Fli> \n     <li>WTG hoist and safety systems<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Personal Protective Equipment, Lad-safe device, harness, lanyards<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Forklift<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Hydraulic torque equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>LIFTRA experience<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EDUCATION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> To perform this job successfully, an individual must demonstrate they can perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and\u002For ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.<\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Education and\u002For Experience: Minimum education requirement is Associates Degree and at least (8) years related experience and\u002For training; or equivalent combination of education and experience in operations and major wind turbine component replacement.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Basic Electricity Experience: Understanding of Ohms Law, the difference and use of AC and DC currents, circuit testing with multi-meter and its fundamentals.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Medium Voltage: Understanding switch gear, pad mount transformer, step-down transformer termination and basic safety. \n      <ul>\n       <li>Language Skills: Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Interpersonal Skills: The ability to lead a team, set achievable goals, monitor performance, coach, resolve differences, identify strengths and weaknesses to better train and manage the team.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Mathematical Skills: Ability to work with and apply mathematical concepts, to include fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Capacity \u002F Proactivity to perform lifting riggings and implementations in main components in order to simplify or facilitate hoisting operation with Self-hoisting device through maneuvers as simplified and safe as possible.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Reasoning Ability: Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Creativity: Ability to imagine the process to anticipate. The ability to see around corners, find new alternatives and options to increase safety and work efficiency.<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b>COMPUTER SKILLS<\u002Fb><b>:<\u002Fb> Knowledge of database, project management, spreadsheet and word processing software, electronic mail, graphics, technical diagrams, flow charts, etc.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>COMPENSATION INFORMATION<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        <div>\n         Ø \n         <b>Salary Position<\u002Fb>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n       <div> \n        <div>\n         Ø \n         <b>Competitive, Based on Experience<\u002Fb>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <br> \n        <div>\n          Ø \n         <b>401K Match<\u002Fb>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <div>\n       <br> \n       <div> \n        <div>\n         Ø \n         <b>Bonus Potential<\u002Fb>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n       <div>\n        <br> \n        <div>\n          Ø \n         <b>Health, Dental &amp; Vision<\u002Fb>\n        <\u002Fdiv>\n       <\u002Fdiv>\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <br> \n     <\u002Fdiv> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b>PHYSICAL DEMANDS &amp; WORK ENVIRONMENT<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p>The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to loud.
