Weight, including harness and tools, must be in accordance with the weight limit as specified by the ANSI Fall Protection Standards.<\u002Fli> \n     <li> Vision\u002FHearing: Ability to interpret and follow a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form.<\u002Fli> \n     <li> Tolerance to Extreme Weather Conditions: Ability to work in adverse weather conditions 35% of the time while on wind farm sites.<\u002Fli> \n     <li> DOT: Annual physical and other requirements, as required by state or federal law.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Qualifications<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Education<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>Preferred<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        Associates or better.\n       <\u002Fdiv> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Experience<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>Required<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <b>8 years:<\u002Fb> related experience \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>Preferred<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       LIFTRA crane experience \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Equal Opportunity Employer\u002FProtected Veterans\u002FIndividuals with Disabilities<\u002Fp> \n   <p>The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.  <p> The Investments and M&amp;A Manager will analyze and execute the evaluation of strategic investments (organic and M&amp;A projects) for EDPR North America. In addition, you will focus on M&amp;A opportunities in wind and solar to cater to the business needs of the company. You will also facilitate investment-related communications and decision-making with EDP and other business units including corporate areas of EDPR. This position will be on a hybrid work schedule, working three days in the office and two days at home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Analyze Technician I is an essential member of the Wind or Solar Farm that is responsible for the on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of equipment at one of EDPR NA’s wind-energy generation sites. Tasks include but are not limited to completing Lock-Out-Tag-Out (LOTO), Tail Board, and documentation that is necessary to support wind turbine maintenance safely. This team member will also conduct inspections of equipment, tools, and facilities for compliance with EDPR policies, governmental safety guidelines, and environmental regulations. The ideal candidate is seeking an opportunity to showcase their knowledge and skills in a dynamic team setting with a passion for renewable energy as EDPR is changing tomorrow now!<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind plant equipment including substation and tower switchgear<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job-appropriate processes and procedures and communicate through appropriate channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify gaps in safety standards and safety risks in the environment, implement effective risk mitigation and provide recommendations to higher-level technical staff and management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Demonstrate and promote integrity, strong initiative, and teamwork<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs and act as a safety role model<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with and respond to EDPRs Remote Operations Control Center when necessary to coordinate remote operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Complete all required training in a satisfactory manner and timeframe<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in on-the-job training with on-site personnel<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Document all work performed using computer-based service reporting procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Adhere to internal controls in effect<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n GED<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Must possess a valid driver’s license and be able to operate a motor vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Effective Communicator<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Mechanical and electrical aptitude<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Troubleshooting and analysis skills.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Preferred: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Technical school education; or an equivalent combination of training and experience.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1 – 2 years relevant experience in wind energy or a related industry.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Understanding of Microsoft products and\u002For complementing products.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong analytical Problem Solving, Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with power plant operations and maintenance, wind plant operations and turbines (including turbine power converters specifically), high voltage switching, and post-operational repair and maintenance of turbines.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Familiarity with maintenance and electronic testing equipment (e.g., voltage testers, amp clamps, hydraulic torque equipment, alignment tools, various hand, and power tools) and with heavy equipment required for facility maintenance including working knowledge of crane and rigging requirements.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge SQL Server software, facility management and reporting systems, and computerized diagnostic and troubleshooting tools<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to work around low- and medium-voltage equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to travel occasionally to other operational sites within the US as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to work overtime on holidays and weekends and to work on short notice as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to respond to site emergencies 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, as needed<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently perform physical tasks including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching approximately 75% of the time while on wind farm sites; ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Walking: <\u002Fb>Ability to walk .25 to .5 miles per day, including across unpaved and rough surfaces when on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or scheduled form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Lifting: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently lift items weighing up to 50 pounds<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Climbing:<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Ability to climb turbine towers in excess of 100 meters in height to access the work area<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Weight, including harness and tools, must be in accordance with the weight limit as specified by the ANSI Fall Protection Standards<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <li><b>Vision\u002FHearing: <\u002Fb>Ability to interpret and follow a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Intermediate level position, the Field Service Technician II (Wind Tech) is an integral member of the Wind or Solar farm with the responsibility of on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of equipment at one of EDPR NA’s operating wind energy generation sites. Tasks include but are not limited to completing Lock-Out-Tag-Out (LOTO), Tail Board, and documentation that is necessary to support wind turbine maintenance safely. This team member will also conduct inspections of equipment, tools, and facilities for compliance with EDPR policies, governmental safety guidelines, and environmental regulations. The ideal candidate is experienced in renewable energy or related industry and is prepared to further their career as part of a global leader in the renewable energy sector.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind plant equipment, including substation and tower switchgear<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job appropriate processes and procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Communicate through appropriate channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Seek assistance when encountering turbine issues outside the trained skill level to ensure success in resolution<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs and act as a safety role model<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Demonstrate and promote integrity and strong initiative<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform data collection and prepare reports in order to meet reporting requirements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with and respond to EDPRs Remote Operations Control Center when necessary to coordinate remote operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform QA\u002FQC inspections in accordance with applicable SOP<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Facilitate periodic equipment inspections and reporting<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Document all work performed using computer-based service reporting procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Complete all required training in a satisfactory manner and timeframe<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Adhere to internal controls in effect<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports:<\u002Fb> None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> up to 10%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Must possess a valid driver’s license and be able to operate a motor vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1+ years of college or technical school education, or an equivalent combination of training and experience.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>2 – 5 years of relevant experience in wind energy or a related industry.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of MS Office software, SQL server software, facility management and reporting systems, and computerized diagnostics and troubleshooting tools<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Familiarity with maintenance and electronic testing equipment (e.g., voltage testers, amp clamps, oscilloscopes, megohmmeters, infrared testers, hydraulic torque equipment, alignment tools, various hand and power tools, and heavy equipment required for facility maintenance)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Working knowledge of crane and rigging requirements<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Preferred: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Understanding of Microsoft products and\u002For complementing products.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in Analytical Problem Solving, Strong Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with power plant operations and maintenance, wind plant operations and turbines (including turbine power converters specifically), high voltage switching, and post-operational repair and maintenance of turbines.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to work around low- and medium-voltage equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Practical problem-solving skills and ability to handle a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Willingness to travel occasionally to other operational sites within the US as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to work overtime on holidays and weekends and to work on short notice as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to respond to site emergencies 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, as needed<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently perform physical tasks including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching approximately 75% of the time while on wind farm sites; ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Walking: <\u002Fb>Ability to walk .25 to .5 miles per day, including across unpaved and rough surfaces when on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or scheduled form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Lifting: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently lift items weighing up to 50 pounds<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Climbing:<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Ability to climb turbine towers in excess of 100 meters in height to access the work area<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Weight, including harness and tools, must be in accordance with the weight limit as specified by the ANSI Fall Protection Standards<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Provide support and guidance to site management to ensure safe operations by implementing and enforcing EDPR’s Health &amp; Safety management systems.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure the implementation and adherence to all EDPR safety procedures, protocols, and standards for all site operations.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Verify that all new employees, visitors, and contractors receive a safety briefing prior to entering the field. Accountable for ensuring that the contractor safety management system is followed and regularly verify third party contractor credentials\u002Fsafety performance while performing any site work for EDPR NA.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Monitor the implementation of Health &amp; Safety behavioral safety programs such as Good Catches, Safe Start, and Stop Work to improve behaviors and promote safety culture. Review submitted good catches and provide QA\u002FQC findings to site management. Coordinate and facilitate daily morning safety briefings for POD, including third party contractor activities, if any.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Train and develop EDPR site personnel on control of work processes (i.e., JSA, LOTO, Work permits, PPE, etc.) through regular tower climbs, on-site trainings, and field inspections. Audit the EDPR LOTO process on a weekly basis to ensure compliance with EDPR procedures and provide findings to site management and Corp. Health, Safety and Quality Department.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Record training completions for site personnel in Campus Online and ensure its integrity<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Report any H&amp;S noncompliance\u002Fviolations and provide recommendations\u002Fguidance for site management toward resolving issues and eliminating occupational hazards. Point of contact for all unplanned events and provide support to site manager for incident case management and subsequent root cause analysis in accordance with EDPR procedures.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Lead for emergency response team and liaise with Health and Safety Department for medical case management guidance. Verify and document the implementation of any corrective actions resulting from incidents or equipment failures.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain, inspect, and track all safety equipment inventory on site. Work with lead technicians and field support engineers to ensure completion of preventative maintenance routines (SAP) for all safety equipment and systems.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide and ensure completion of Health &amp; Safety awareness training for all site personnel, including pertinent third-party contractors. Liaise with L&amp;D team to ensure employees receive all required training. Review new hires prior training and certifications for transferability to EDPR requirements. Record completed trainings, and schedule TBC Assessments for site personnel in Campus Online.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist site personnel with training registration, coordination, execution, and recording. Interface with internal and external trainers for scheduling and coordinating both on and off-site training for site personnel.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Verify and audit current training requirements for all EDPR personnel on site in accordance with EDPR safety training procedure on a quarterly basis.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Conduct Regional Safety Coordinator audits as per annual Health, Safety and Quality annual audit requirements and take part in all monthly RSC Health and Safety meetings.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct Reports:<\u002Fb> 0<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> 20% or as needed<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Associate’s degree or equivalent experience in a related field<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1–2 years of Health &amp; <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Field Service Technician III (Wind Tech) is responsible for troubleshooting complex electrical, hydraulic, and mechanical systems to maintain wind turbine operation at EDPR NA’s wind-energy generation sites. Responsibilities also include active involvement in major correctives and major component repair and replacements in the safest manner possible and at the lowest overall cost.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind turbine equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to appropriate processes and procedures and communicate through proper channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist in Task Base Certification program development and implementation<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform advanced-level troubleshooting for component repair and replacements with proficient use of specialized tools and diagnostic processes<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Effectively gather information regarding turbine performance\u002Fissues to diagnose, recommend, and implement solutions to complex issues<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Demonstrate effective project leadership and delegation for major correctives, retrofits, and main component repair\u002Freplacements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Closely adhere to all safety standards and procedures and act as a safety role model by encouraging and recognizing others completing safe acts and intervening when unsafe acts are being practiced<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify gaps in safety standards and safety risks in the work environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Implement effective risk mitigations and provide recommendations to higher-level technical staff and management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform data collection and prepare reports in order to meet reporting requirements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform QA\u002FQC inspections in accordance with applicable SOP<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Facilitate periodic equipment inspections and reporting<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Document all work performed using computer-based service reporting procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist teammates in accomplishing operational objectives as well as mentoring lower-level technical staff<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>minimal, as needed<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>3+ years of college or technical school education, or an equivalent combination of training and experience<\u002Fli> \n     <li>4 – 6 years of relevant experience in wind energy or a related industry<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to operate a motor vehicle and possession of a valid driver’s license<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to work around low- and medium-voltage equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with power plant operations and maintenance, wind plant operations and turbines (including turbine power converters specifically), high voltage switching, and post-operational repair and maintenance of turbines preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to respond to site emergencies 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, as needed, and on short notice as needed due to on-call scheduling<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to work weekends, holidays, and overtime as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong ability to read, interpret, and understand drawings and schematics to develop work instructions for planned activities ensuring risks are identified and mitigated<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to lead a crew and provide technical direction on a daily basis<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong attention to detail and execution excellence<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Continuously demonstrate and promote integrity, strong initiative, and a no-compromise focus on safety and quality of work<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Able to effectively collaborate with employees at all professional levels to foster a strong team environment.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Be a champion for change and promote company initiatives enabling team spirit and cooperation<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Independently execute and perform tasks according to general guidance and operational objectives<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> <\u002Fb><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently perform physical tasks including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching approximately 75% of the time while on wind farm sites; ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment<\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Walking: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently walk across unpaved and rough surfaces when on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or scheduled form<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b>Lifting: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently lift items weighing up to 50 pounds<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b>Climbing:<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Ability to routinely climb turbine ladders in excess of 100 meters in height to access the work area<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Weight, including harness and tools, must be in accordance with the weight limit as specified by the ANSI Fall Protection Standards<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <li><b>Vision\u002FHearing: <\u002Fb>Strong ability to interpret and follow a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Tolerance to Extreme Weather Conditions: <\u002Fb>Ability to work in adverse weather conditions while on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Safety:<\u002Fb> Ability to understand and communicate safety precautions when necessary<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Senior Services Procurement Analyst will provide support to the Services Procurement department by supporting multiple competitive bid processes, including negotiating and writing vendor contracts for all services related to the development, design and construction of wind, solar, and battery storage projects. You will also support Procurement’s organization and process team in the supplier qualification process and additional reporting as necessary.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Assist Services Procurement Manager and Procurement Associate with the development of contracting strategies and processes for tendering Requests for Proposals (RFPs)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively, reviewing and levelizing vendor proposals, identifying potential risks and negotiating contracts that result in the best value possible<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with the creation and documentation of a competitive bid process that can be used at all levels of the organization<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Serve as a liaison between the Procurement, Development, Engineering, Project Management, Finance, and Estimation departments<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage relationships and interfaces with suppliers during the RFP process<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain responsibility for bid evaluations, direct Contractor interaction for commercial and contractual negotiations, and contract approval prior to contract finalization<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with the creation and documentation of a competitive bid process that can be used at all levels of the organization<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with the contract award process and produce the presentation of award recommendations to executive level management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide support to the organization and processes function including tracking supplier qualification documents for the approval of suppliers to ensure timely and accurate processing to meet deadlines<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage documentation, contracts, budgets, schedules, engineering and construction interfaces, project controls, project correspondence, and project reporting on a weekly basis<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Organize and prepare agendas for meetings between Contractors and Procurement personnel<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>0<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> 0% - 10%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum supply chain, business operations, engineering, construction management, or industry manufacturing experience, including experience with external contract negotiation for services<\u002Fli> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <b>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb>\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     Intermediate level position, the Wind Technician II is an integral member of the Wind farm with the responsibility of on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of equipment at one of EDPR NA’s operating wind energy generation sites. Tasks include but are not limited to completing Lock-Out-Tag-Out (LOTO), Tail Board, and documentation that is necessary to support wind turbine maintenance safely. This team member will also conduct inspections of equipment, tools, and facilities for compliance with EDPR policies, governmental safety guidelines, and environmental regulations. The ideal candidate is experienced in renewable energy or related industry and is prepared to further their career as part of a global leader in the renewable energy sector.\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div><\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     <b>Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb>\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     <ul>\n      <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind plant equipment, including substation and tower switchgear<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job appropriate processes and procedures<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Communicate through appropriate channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Seek assistance when encountering turbine issues outside the trained skill level to ensure success in the resolution<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs and act as a safety role model<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Demonstrate and promote integrity and strong initiative<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Perform data collection and prepare reports in order to meet reporting requirements<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Work with and respond to EDPRs Remote Operations Control Center when necessary to coordinate remote operations<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Perform QA\u002FQC inspections in accordance with applicable SOP<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Facilitate periodic equipment inspections and reporting<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Document all work performed using computer-based service reporting procedures<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Complete all required training in a satisfactory manner and timeframe<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Adhere to internal controls in effect<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     <b>Travel: <\u002Fb>up to 10%\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div><\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     <b>Minimum technical school education, or an equivalent combination of training and experience.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>2 – 5 years of relevant experience in wind energy or a related industry.<\u002Fli> \n  <p> The Performance Analyst will analyze events with a high impact on the performance of the solar and wind power plants. You will also support the development and future improvements of the Big Data system, as well as the coordination with other departments so Performance Management can have the right inputs for the analysis and monitoring activities.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Perform analyses of solar and wind turbine performance to identify performance improvement opportunities and complete detailed comparisons against targets<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Utilize statistics and dashboards to improve plant performance<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the development and monitoring of global performance indicators by learning and utilizing statistical modeling software<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Collaborate with North American and European staff to ensure proper equipment operation and maximization of overall facility performance<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Interface with engineering, asset management, and finance staff and other individuals both internally and externally<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Collaborate with SCADA team to ensure systems are collecting and calculating data elements correctly<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform ad-hoc forward-looking analyses on plant operations and performance<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Write ad-hoc queries in SQL and python to capture data for analysis<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop software tools to analyze asset conditions and performance using Power BI, SQL, and python<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Create and maintain Azure Cloud resources<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with technical staff to identify turbine modifications that can increase<br> performance, and quantifies the financial benefit to the project<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> up to 10%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Bachelor’s degree in a technical field; (Preferred).<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to comprehend and apply a variety of subjects relating to wind energy, including meteorology, aerodynamics, and electrical and mechanical systems<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to perform duties in a collaborative working environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with network-based enterprise-reporting<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proven ability to quickly learn new software programs<\u002Fli> \n     <li>A technical understanding of the electric power and wind industries<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Statistical and analytical skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Problem-solving ability<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Oral and written communication and presentation skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to be self-motivated<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical demands &amp; execute evaluation of strategic investments (organic and M&amp;A projects) for EDPR North America. In addition, you will focus on originating attractive M&amp;A opportunities in wind and solar to cater to the business needs of the company and lead all of the M&amp;A execution efforts in coordination with the department head. You will also facilitate investment-related communications and decision making with EDP and other business units including corporate areas of EDPR. This position will be on a hybrid work schedule, working three days in office and two days from home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Lead and coordinate the analysis of Greenfield projects in terms of economic risks and strategic options and undertake oversight of the team’s efforts in carrying out valuation and sensitivity analyses of various opportunities generated by the platform<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Coordinate the efforts of the internal teams of the platform to prepare investment memos and liaise with EDPR\u002FEDP decision making bodies for required approvals<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Originate and evaluate M&amp;A opportunities and lead the negotiation of transaction documentation and structuring<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Evaluate divestment opportunities and assist the head of the department in the execution of asset rotation targets for the platform<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in strategic analysis projects (i.e., Special Projects)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Analyze and support bid strategies for Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Oversee the impairment analysis process for the platform<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Oversee and mentor the junior members of the team and integrate the new recruits to the team<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>General Description<\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Environmental Senior Analyst will support environmental and permitting activities for the EDPR North American (EDPR NA) platform ensuring that the Company’s projects meet corporate standards and pertinent regulatory requirements, as well as support operating assets with environmental regulatory compliance matters and EDPR NA’s ISO 14001 certified Environmental, Health &amp; Safety Management System (EHSMS). The Environmental Senior Analyst will also manage environmental compliance for projects under construction while creating and promoting a culture of environmental excellence and consummate compliance with standards and regulations.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Operating Projects <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Assists with other procurement activities, such as contracting and processing invoices<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide training and guidance to EDPR NA staff regarding environmental issues<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Advises operation managers regarding interpretation of environmental regulations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assists with compliance with federal, state, and local permitting and regulatory environmental requirements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensures that permits are obtained, renewed, and closed as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manages project obligation tracker to ensure that fulfillment of permit obligations are documented<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensures that environmental plans and programs are implemented and maintained as required by federal, state, and local regulatory requirements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develops, maintain, and improve on a waste management program that strives to minimize waste generation and waste management-related risks<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Schedules and conducts annual compliance assessments<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Project Development <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Supports environmental aspects of EDPR NA’s projects from planning phases through implementation<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Supports projects by compiling documentation, attending meetings, ensuring necessary studies are conducted, and performing other tasks as needed to obtain permits for wind farms at the local, state, and federal level<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assists with development of scopes of work for procurement of environmental and permitting services<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Supports management of environmental compliance for EDPR NA’s energy projects under construction<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>General Accountabilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Functions in a communicative and collaborative environment with diverse internal stakeholder teams<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manages, control, and administers environmental management system documents and procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support EDPR NA’s Environmental Health &amp; Safety Management System (EHSMS) and improvements for operating assets<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensures that environmental records and documentation are properly maintained<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Contracts and manages work of environmental consultants<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Attend agency meetings and site visits as needed and lead strategy meetings<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>30%<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Minimum Qualifications<\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor’s degree in a related field (engineering, project management, biology, environmental studies, etc.)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>At least two years of relevant professional experience<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Knowledge and competency in Microsoft Office software (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, Outlook, etc.)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Familiarity with ArcGIS and\u002For willingness to learn<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Knowledge of wildlife laws (ESA, MBTA, BGEPA)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Knowledge of EPCRA, SPCC, CWA, and waste management regulations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Knowledge of ISO 14001 Standard<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with management system audits is a plus<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with California laws and regulations is a plus<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in analytical problem solving, strong communication, customer\u002Fpartner relationships, and technology expertise preferred<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong analytical skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>High attention to detail and strong interpersonal and teamwork skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to work and perform well in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to work productively with limited supervision<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong interest in environmental issues and renewable energy<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical demands &amp; working conditions <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to stand and <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     Exciting entry-level position, the Wind Technician I is an essential member of the Wind Farm that is responsible for the on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of equipment at one of EDPR NA’s wind-energy generation sites. Tasks include but are not limited to completing Lock-Out-Tag-Out (LOTO), Tail Board, and documentation that is necessary to support wind turbine maintenance safely. This team member will also conduct inspections of equipment, tools, and facilities for compliance with EDPR policies, governmental safety guidelines, and environmental regulations. The ideal candidate is seeking an opportunity to showcase their knowledge and skills in a dynamic team setting with a passion for renewable energy as EDPR is changing tomorrow now!\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     <b>This is a 6-8 Month Temporary Assignment for our Meadow Lake Wind Farm in Chalmers, IN.<\u002Fb>\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div><\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     <b>Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb>\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     <ul>\n      <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind plant equipment including substation and tower switchgear<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job-appropriate processes and procedures and communicate through appropriate channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Identify gaps in safety standards and safety risks in the environment, implement effective risk mitigation and provide recommendations to higher-level technical staff and management<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Demonstrate and promote integrity, strong initiative, and teamwork<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs and act as a safety role model<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Work with and respond to EDPRs Remote Operations Control Center when necessary to coordinate remote operations<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Complete all required training in a satisfactory manner and timeframe<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Participate in on-the-job training with on-site personnel<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Document all work performed using computer-based service reporting procedures<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Adhere to internal controls in effect<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     <b>Travel: <\u002Fb>Up to 10%\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n turbines.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Familiarity with maintenance and electronic testing equipment (e.g., voltage testers, amp clamps, hydraulic torque equipment, alignment tools, various hand, and power <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Business Development Analyst will develop documentations and presentations that support EDPR NA’s origination negotiations and client relations. You will also analyze market and regulatory trends to aid decision makers in identifying the most value-adding revenue strategy for the company’s projects. This role will assist with commercial deal structure and power purchase agreement (PPA) negotiations. This position will be on a hybrid remote work schedule, working three days in office and two days from home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li> documents in order to support negotiation activities<\u002Fli> \n     <li> Work internally to analyze regulatory, siting, transmission, and other market design effects on proposed renewable projects <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Analyze the impact of current market rules by ISO on renewable projects<\u002Fli> \n     <li> Maintain accurate records in the company customer relationship management (CRM) system<\u002Fli> \n     <li> Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>0 direct reports<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>up to 50%<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Exciting entry-level position, the Field Service Technician I (Wind Tech) is an essential member of the Wind or Solar Farm that is responsible for the on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of equipment at one of EDPR NA’s wind-energy generation sites. Tasks include but are not limited to completing Lock-Out-Tag-Out (LOTO), Tail Board, and documentation that is necessary to support wind turbine maintenance safely. This team member will also conduct inspections of equipment, tools, and facilities for compliance with EDPR policies, governmental safety guidelines, and environmental regulations. The ideal candidate is seeking an opportunity to showcase their knowledge and skills in a dynamic team setting with a passion for renewable energy as EDPR is changing tomorrow now!<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind plant equipment including substation and tower switchgear<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job-appropriate processes and procedures and communicate through appropriate channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify gaps in safety standards and safety risks in the environment, implement effective risk mitigation and provide recommendations to higher-level technical staff and management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Demonstrate and promote integrity, strong initiative, and teamwork<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs and act as a safety role model<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with and respond to EDPRs Remote Operations Control Center when necessary to coordinate remote operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Complete all required training in a satisfactory manner and timeframe<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in on-the-job training with on-site personnel<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Document all work performed using computer-based service reporting procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Adhere to internal controls in effect<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>Up to 10%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>High school diploma or GED<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Must possess a valid driver’s license and be able to operate a motor vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Effective Communicator<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Mechanical and electrical aptitude<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Troubleshooting and analysis skills.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Preferred: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Technical school education; or an equivalent combination of training and experience.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1 – 2 years relevant experience in wind energy or a related industry.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Understanding of Microsoft products and\u002For complementing products.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong analytical Problem Solving, Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with power plant operations and maintenance, wind plant operations and turbines (including turbine power converters specifically), high voltage switching, and post-operational repair and maintenance of turbines.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Familiarity with maintenance and electronic testing equipment (e.g., voltage testers, amp clamps, hydraulic torque equipment, alignment tools, various hand, and power tools) and with heavy equipment required for facility maintenance including working knowledge of crane and rigging requirements.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge SQL Server software, facility management and reporting systems, and computerized diagnostic and troubleshooting tools<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to work around low- and medium-voltage equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to travel occasionally to other operational sites within the US as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to work overtime on holidays and weekends and to work on short notice as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to respond to site emergencies 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, as needed<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently perform physical tasks including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching approximately 75% of the time while on wind farm sites; ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Walking: <\u002Fb>Ability to walk .25 to .5 miles per day, including across unpaved and rough surfaces when on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or scheduled form<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b>Lifting: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently lift items weighing up to 50 pounds<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Climbing:<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Ability to climb turbine towers in excess of 100 meters in height to access the work area<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Weight, including harness and tools, must be in accordance with the weight limit as specified by the ANSI Fall Protection Standards<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <li><b>Vision\u002FHearing: <\u002Fb>Ability to interpret and follow a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Tolerance to Extreme Weather Conditions: <\u002Fb>Ability to work in adverse weather conditions 25% of the time while on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Energy Storage Analytics Senior Associate is responsible for supporting the development of energy storage simulation and management tools and reports, conforming with market rules and performance requirements and the dispatch of operational projects aiming at maximizing revenues under multiple use cases and configurations (hybrid and standalone; behind and front-of-the-meter). The person in this role will be the main point of contact of the Team with ISOs\u002FRTOs, Energy Management System vendors, Operations and Technical Departments. This position will be on a hybrid remote work schedule, working three days in office and two days from home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Survey and ensure up-to-date proper modeling of the market rules governing energy storage participation in all relevant wholesale markets.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Track regulatory developments related to energy storage at the federal and state levels with commercial implications.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Assist in the development of applications intended to collect\u002Fmonitor real time data from Energy Storage Systems.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Support the development of optimization models and strategies for energy storage market participation.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Assist in the development of applications capable of dispatching Energy Storage Systems to maximize revenues from projects.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Make recommendations intended at managing capacity degradation of energy storage projects, based on best practices\u002Ffindings in operational data.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Produce reports with relevant information on energy storage systems performance and market participation.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Support origination and\u002For energy sales efforts as needed, related to energy storage systems.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Work as part of a team, supporting and leading initiatives that enhance the group’s capabilities and performance.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Other duties as assigned.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b>Travel<\u002Fb> – 10% or as needed<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b>DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor’s degree in a related field<\u002Fli> \n     <li>5 + years of experience in the renewables sector or academic research setting<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Preferred: Master’s in data science or similar.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of Python, SQL, <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Intermediate level position, the Field Service Technician II (Wind Tech) is an integral member of the Wind or Solar farm with the responsibility of on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of equipment at one of EDPR NA’s operating wind energy generation sites. Tasks include but are not limited to completing Lock-Out-Tag-Out (LOTO), Tail Board, and documentation that is necessary to support wind turbine maintenance safely. This team member will also conduct inspections of equipment, tools, and facilities for compliance with EDPR policies, governmental safety guidelines, and environmental regulations. The ideal candidate is experienced in renewable energy or related industry and is prepared to further their career as part of a global leader in the renewable energy sector.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind plant equipment, including substation and tower switchgear<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job appropriate processes and procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Communicate through appropriate channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Seek assistance when encountering turbine issues outside the trained skill level to ensure success in resolution<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs and act as a safety role model<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Demonstrate and promote integrity and strong initiative<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform data collection and prepare reports in order to meet reporting requirements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with and respond to EDPRs Remote Operations Control Center when necessary to coordinate remote operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform QA\u002FQC inspections in accordance with applicable SOP<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Facilitate periodic equipment inspections and reporting<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Document all work performed using computer-based service reporting procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Complete all required training in a satisfactory manner and timeframe<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Adhere to internal controls in effect<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Direct reports:<\u002Fb> None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> up to 10%<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Must possess a valid driver’s license and be able to operate a motor vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1+ years of college or technical school education, or an equivalent combination of training and experience.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>2 – 5 years of relevant experience in wind energy or a related industry.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of MS Office software, SQL server software, facility <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Solar FST II is responsible for the on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of solar field equipment at EDPR NA’s operating solar-energy generation site. This includes, but is not limited to: completing Lock out Tag out (LOTO), Tail Board meetings, and job specific documentation that is required to conduct PV solar system maintenance in the safest manner possible. You will perform inspections of equipment, tools and facility for compliance with EDPR policies, governmental safety guidelines, and environmental regulations.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of solar field equipment and associated solar plant components, including inverters, tracker systems, transformers, substations and switchgear<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job appropriate processes and procedures and communicate through appropriate channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Read schematics in order to troubleshoot complicated mechanical, and electrical, problems with invertors, tracker control systems, PV panels, and components<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform mechanical and electrical component repair and replacement of parts to correct malfunctions in accordance with all pertinent manufacturers' requirements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Effectively gather information and prepare reports on solar performance\u002Fissues<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Diagnose, recommend, and implement solutions up to intermediate routine issues<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Seek assistance when encountering issues outside trained skill level to ensure success in resolution<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Act as a safety role model; encourage and recognize others completing safe acts and intervene when unsafe acts are being practiced<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify gaps in safety standards as well as safety risks in the environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Implement effective risk mitigation and provide recommendations to higher level technical staff and management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Promote integrity, strong initiative, and a no-compromise focus on safety and quality of work on a continuous basis<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform preventive maintenance in accordance with OEM maintenance manuals<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with and respond to EDPRs Remote Operations Control Center when necessary<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform QA\u002FQC inspections in accordance with applicable SOP<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure that reliable electronic communication is maintained between the solar field, substation, site office, and home office<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Document all work performed using computer based service reporting procedures (SAP)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Adhere to effective internal controls<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Supervise contractors on site to ensure compliance with all EDPR’s policy and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports:<\u002Fb> None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>minimal, as needed<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Minimum Requirements:<\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>High school diploma or GED required<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1+ years of college or technical school education, or an equivalent combination of training and experience<\u002Fli> \n     <li>2 – 5 years relevant experience in solar energy or a related industry, Wind energy experience is a plus.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Working knowledge of Microsoft Office products<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Familiarity with facility management and reporting systems, computerized diagnostic and troubleshooting tools, and maintenance and electronic testing equipment (e.g., voltage testers, amp clamps, oscilloscopes, megohmmeters, infrared testers, torque equipment, alignment tools, various hand and power tools) and with heavy equipment required for facility maintenance, including working knowledge of crane and rigging requirements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in Analytical Problem Solving, Strong Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise. (Preferred)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Must possess a valid driver’s license and have the ability to operate a motor vehicle<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral Qualifications: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Ability to work in adverse weather conditions<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to work around low, medium, and high voltage equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to interpret and follow a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong written and oral communication skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of variables in situations where only limited standardization exists<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to travel occasionally to other operational sites within the US as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to work overtime on holidays and weekends and to work on short notice as needed due to on-call scheduling<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with power plant operations and maintenance, solar plant operations, (including power inverters specifically), high-voltage switching, and post-operational repair and maintenance of solar field components preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to respond to site emergencies 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, as needed<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical Demands &amp; Working Conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently perform physical tasks including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching approximately 75% of the time while on solar farm sites; ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Walking: <\u002Fb>Ability to walk 2 to 5 miles per day, including across unpaved and rough surfaces when on solar farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b>Lifting: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently lift items weighing up to 60 pounds and to occasionally lift items weighing between 60 and 100 pounds<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b>Vision\u002FHearing: <\u002Fb>Ability to interpret and follow a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Tolerance to Extreme Weather Conditions: <\u002Fb>Ability to work in adverse weather conditions 25% of the time while on solar farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Safety:<\u002Fb> Ability to understand and communicate safety precautions when necessary<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Travel Required<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Yes. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Real Estate Paralegal will be responsible for assisting legal counsel with matters relating to the company’s acquisition and maintenance of real property interests. This position will be on a hybrid work schedule, working three days in the office and two days from home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Complete form real estate documents, including options, option memoranda, purchase and sale agreements, leases, lease memoranda, easements, easement memoranda, assignments, notices of exercise, escrow letters, correspondence<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform real estate due diligence of purchase and sale, mergers, and finance transactions by preparing checklists, timelines, issues lists and document schedules<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Review title reports, identify issues, and prepare title schedules<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist the General Counsel, Associate General Counsel, and other department Attorneys with satisfying title requirements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Coordinate with title companies to obtain title reports and title documents in accordance with project time schedules<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Review on the land survey and site plans<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist in the preparation of proforma title policies<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Remind the General Counsel, Associate General Counsel, and Real Estate Attorney of key dates and timelines<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with document compliance and preparing document summaries<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with approving real estate documents for execution and payment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist in preparing form documents for the development, construction, and operation of projects<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with maintenance of Company documents<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Answer questions on routine document requirements of the Company<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Exciting entry-level position, the Field Service Technician I (Wind Tech) is an essential member of the Wind or Solar Farm that is responsible for the on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of equipment at one of EDPR NA’s wind-energy generation sites. Tasks include but are not limited to completing Lock-Out-Tag-Out (LOTO), Tail Board, and documentation that is necessary to support wind turbine maintenance safely. This team member will also conduct inspections of equipment, tools, and facilities for compliance with EDPR policies, governmental safety guidelines, and environmental regulations. The ideal candidate is seeking an opportunity to showcase their knowledge and skills in a dynamic team setting with a passion for renewable energy as EDPR is changing tomorrow now!<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind plant equipment including substation and tower switchgear<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job-appropriate processes and procedures and communicate through appropriate channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify gaps in safety standards and safety risks in the environment, implement effective risk mitigation and provide recommendations to higher-level technical staff and management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Demonstrate and promote integrity, strong initiative, and teamwork<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs and act as a safety role model<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with and respond to EDPRs Remote Operations Control Center when necessary to coordinate remote operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Complete all required training in a satisfactory manner and timeframe<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in on-the-job training with on-site personnel<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Document all work performed using computer-based service reporting procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Adhere to internal controls in effect<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>Up to 10%<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>High school diploma or GED<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Must possess a valid driver’s license and be able to operate a motor vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Effective Communicator<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Mechanical and electrical aptitude<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Troubleshooting and analysis skills.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Preferred: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Technical school education; or an equivalent combination of training and experience.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1 – 2 years relevant experience in wind energy or a related industry.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Understanding of Microsoft products and\u002For complementing products.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong analytical Problem Solving, Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with power plant operations and maintenance, wind plant operations and turbines (including turbine power converters specifically), high voltage switching, and post-operational repair and maintenance of turbines.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Familiarity with maintenance and electronic testing equipment (e.g., voltage testers, amp clamps, hydraulic torque equipment, alignment tools, various hand, and power tools) and with heavy equipment required for facility maintenance including working knowledge of crane and rigging requirements.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge SQL Server software, facility management and reporting systems, and computerized diagnostic and troubleshooting tools<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to work around low- and medium-voltage equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to travel occasionally to other operational sites within the US as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to work overtime on holidays and weekends and to work on short notice as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to respond to site emergencies 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently perform physical tasks including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching approximately 75% of the time while on wind farm sites; ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Walking: <\u002Fb>Ability to walk .25 to .5 miles per day, including across unpaved and rough surfaces when on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or scheduled form<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b>Lifting: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently lift items weighing up to 50 pounds<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Climbing:<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Ability to climb turbine towers in excess of 100 meters in height to access the work area<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Weight, including harness and tools, must be in accordance with the weight limit as specified by the ANSI Fall Protection Standards<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <li><b>Vision\u002FHearing: <\u002Fb>Ability to interpret and follow a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Tolerance to Extreme Weather Conditions: <\u002Fb>Ability to work in adverse weather conditions 25% of the time while on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Safety:<\u002Fb> Ability to understand and communicate safety precautions when necessary<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n
