<div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Exciting entry-level position, the Field Service Technician I (Wind Tech) is an essential member of the Wind or Solar Farm that is responsible for the on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of equipment at one of EDPR NA’s wind-energy generation sites. Tasks include but are not limited to completing Lock-Out-Tag-Out (LOTO), Tail Board, and documentation that is necessary to support wind turbine maintenance safely. This team member will also conduct inspections of equipment, tools, and facilities for compliance with EDPR policies, governmental safety guidelines, and environmental regulations. The ideal candidate is seeking an opportunity to showcase their knowledge and skills in a dynamic team setting with a passion for renewable energy as EDPR is changing tomorrow now!<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind plant equipment including substation and tower switchgear<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job-appropriate processes and procedures and communicate through appropriate channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify gaps in safety standards and safety risks in the environment, implement effective risk mitigation and provide recommendations to higher-level technical staff and management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Demonstrate and promote integrity, strong initiative, and teamwork<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs and act as a safety role model<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with and respond to EDPRs Remote Operations Control Center when necessary to coordinate remote operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Complete all required training in a satisfactory manner and timeframe<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in on-the-job training with on-site personnel<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Document all work performed using computer-based service reporting procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Adhere to internal controls in effect<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>Up to 10%<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>High school diploma or GED<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Must possess a valid driver’s license and be able to operate a motor vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Effective Communicator<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Mechanical and electrical aptitude<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Troubleshooting and analysis skills.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Preferred: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Technical school education; or an equivalent combination of training and experience.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1 – 2 years relevant experience in wind energy or a related industry.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Understanding of Microsoft products and\u002For complementing products.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong analytical Problem Solving, Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with power plant operations and maintenance, wind plant operations and turbines (including turbine power converters specifically), high voltage switching, and post-operational repair and maintenance of turbines.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Familiarity with maintenance and electronic testing equipment (e.g., voltage testers, amp clamps, hydraulic torque equipment, alignment tools, various hand, and power tools) and with heavy equipment required for facility maintenance including working knowledge of crane and rigging requirements.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge SQL Server software, facility management and reporting systems, and computerized diagnostic and troubleshooting tools<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to work around low- and medium-voltage equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to travel occasionally to other operational sites within the US as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to work overtime on holidays and weekends and to work on short notice as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to respond to site emergencies 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, as needed<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently perform physical tasks including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching approximately 75% of the time while on wind farm sites; ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Walking: <\u002Fb>Ability to walk .25 to .5 miles per day, including across unpaved and rough surfaces when on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or scheduled form<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b>Lifting: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently lift items weighing up to 50 pounds<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Climbing:<\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Ability to climb turbine towers in excess of 100 meters in height to access the work area<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Weight, including harness and tools, must be in accordance with the weight limit as specified by the ANSI Fall Protection Standards<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <li><b>Vision\u002FHearing: <\u002Fb>Ability to interpret and follow a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Tolerance to Extreme Weather Conditions: <\u002Fb>Ability to work in adverse weather conditions 25% of the time while on wind farm sites<\u002Fli> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Intermediate level position, the Field Service Technician II (Wind Tech) is an integral member of the Wind or Solar farm with the responsibility of on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of equipment at one of EDPR NA’s operating wind energy generation sites. Tasks include but are not limited to completing Lock-Out-Tag-Out (LOTO), Tail Board, and documentation that is necessary to support wind turbine maintenance safely. This team member will also conduct inspections of equipment, tools, and facilities for compliance with EDPR policies, governmental safety guidelines, and environmental regulations. The ideal candidate is experienced in renewable energy or related industry and is prepared to further their career as part of a global leader in the renewable energy sector.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind plant equipment, including substation and tower switchgear<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job appropriate processes and procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Communicate through appropriate channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Seek assistance when encountering turbine issues outside the trained skill level to ensure success in resolution<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs and act as a safety role model<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Demonstrate and promote integrity and strong initiative<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform data collection and prepare reports in order to meet reporting requirements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with and respond to EDPRs Remote Operations Control Center when necessary to coordinate remote operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform QA\u002FQC inspections in accordance with applicable SOP<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Facilitate periodic equipment inspections and reporting<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Document all work performed using computer-based service reporting procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Complete all required training in a satisfactory manner and timeframe<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Adhere to internal controls in effect<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Direct reports:<\u002Fb> None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> up to 10%<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Must possess a valid driver’s license and be able to operate a motor vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1+ years of college or technical school education, or an equivalent combination of training and experience.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>2 – 5 years of relevant experience in wind energy or a related industry.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of MS Office software, SQL server software, facility management and reporting systems, and computerized diagnostics and troubleshooting tools<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Familiarity with maintenance and electronic testing equipment (e.g., voltage testers, amp clamps, oscilloscopes, megohmmeters, infrared testers, hydraulic torque equipment, alignment tools, various hand and power tools, and heavy equipment required for facility maintenance)<\u002Fli> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <b>General Description<\u002Fb>\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     The Operations Support Compliance Engineer will provide engineering support to the ROCC, High Voltage Operations, and Operational Technology teams in the areas of compliance, process effectiveness, betterment of project development, and interdepartmental communication. This position will have emphasis placed on compliance with NERC PRC and MOD Reliability Standards.\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div><\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     <b>Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb>\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     <ul>\n      <li>Ensure high standard of compliance of EDPR NA assets with all applicable NERC PRC and MOD Reliability Standards<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Subject matter expert for the creation and maintenance of documentation, procedures, processes to demonstrate compliance with NERC PRC and MOD standards.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Generate, monitor, and report progress on compliance activities, implementation plans, and mitigation plans for NERC Standards related to PRC and MOD.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Review RSAWs, maintain and provide compliance evidence periodically in support of compliance readiness and internal and external audits.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Acquire a thorough understanding of EDPR NA’s assets and processes<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Establish effective relationships inside and outside of the company to ensure the department’s objectives are achieved<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Assist Operations Support teams and the Lean team in identifying process improvements and developing solutions with an emphasis on NERC compliance<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Manage internal and external support, OEMs, and Engineering Service Providers performing bulk power system studies using power system modeling software, including PSCAD, PSLF, PSS\u002FE, TSAT, etc.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Perform onsite and remote NERC Compliance testing for renewable power generating plants for MOD-026\u002F027<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Conduct engineering studies for new and emerging technologies such as inverters, wind turbines, or Bulk Energy Storage Systems, which may require interaction with equipment vendors to complete the analyses<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Gather, generate, and maintain data for engineering studies and NERC Compliance evidence<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Assist with monitoring the knowledge-sharing databases to include compliance efforts and other internal compliance tracking tools and provide suggestions for process improvements<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Assist in creating project scope of work and specifications documentation as necessary to ensure compliance obligations are being met<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Serve as a liaison between Operations Support Teams and various internal departments on technical and compliance issues<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Participate in various task forces related to RCA’s, compliance investigations, and other operational investigations<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Assist with incorporating “Lessons Learned” in the Engineering Design Standards and Standard HV BOP Scope of Work documents from a compliance and operations perspective<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Work closely with ROCC, Performance Management, and Analysis teams to lead and develop periodic reports for monitoring NERC compliance in real time<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Other duties as assigned<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <div><\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>0\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     <b>Travel: <\u002Fb>up to 20%\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div><\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     <b>Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb>\n    <\u002Fdiv> \n    <div>\n     <ul>\n      <li>Bachelor’s degree or higher in Electrical Engineering with power systems emphasis, or similar and equivalent related experience<\u002Fli> \n      <li>2+ years of relevant maintenance, operations, design, or consulting experience, preferably including some NERC compliance responsibilities<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Experience performing and reviewing NERC Compliance Studies for NERC PRC-005, PRC-019, PRC-023, PRC-024, PRC-025, PRC-027, MOD-025, MOD-026, MOD-027 and MOD-032 NERC Reliability Standards<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Knowledge and experience with power systems simulation software such as PSCAD, PSS\u002FE, TSAT, PSLF.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Experience and familiarity with relays and protection systems compliance on high voltage substations<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Strong technical and report writing skills<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office and preferred familiarity with SQL database applications, Business Intelligence and Business Management Systems (Appian, Tableau, OSI PI), and reporting tools &amp; processes<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <div><\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb>\n environment and work independently<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Ability to build relationships with internal and external parties<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Work extended hours on short notice when necessary<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Ability to interpret NERC reliability standards<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Ability to interpret electrical drawings<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Ability to gather relevant data using appropriate methods and analyze that data to propose process and tools improvement<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Ability to interpret equipment manuals and work instructions from a variety of <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The HV Reliability Engineering Specialist will provide front-line High Voltage (HV) Electrical Equipment support to operating wind farms across the Company. You will serve, in conjunction with other High Voltage Operations staff and the Electrical Engineers in Houston, as the Company’s subject matter expert on essentially all HV issues.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Provide electrical, high-voltage, collection system, and substation support to operating wind farms including constant on-call support<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide support and feedback regarding electrical design, engineering, testing, and construction as requested<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support and coordinate commissioning, start-up, and initial operating activities<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Optimize scheduled maintenance with consideration of available and forecasted fuel resource, weather, and reactive maintenance activities<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Report problems and update activities in the SAP CMMS as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain inventory, inspection, and calibration of all tooling and equipment as required<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage the HV spare parts inventory of the Renewable Power Plants in the applicable zone<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform safe switching and grounding of HV equipment including circuit breakers, disconnect switches, power transformers, and all related components as necessary<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in the engineering, design, and construction review processes including review of collection system, substation, and transmission line designs<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop and implement site betterment projects including preparation of scope documents, exhibits, budgets, schedules, and requests for proposals (RFPs)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support and coordinate electrical equipment maintenance at company facilities with LO\u002FTO and outage planning<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Serve as an example and ambassador of safe work practices<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform equipment inspections and testing and store the reports in the respective depository to ensure compliance with the applicable NERC standards<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform emergency and routine repairs that may require specialized tools, materials, or permits<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Train subordinates and other EDPR NA field personnel to perform IR thermography, electrical equipment maintenance, and prepare them to operate collection system and substation equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports:<\u002Fb> up to 4<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> 30%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or an equivalent combination of training and experience<\u002Fli> \n     <li>5+ years of relevant technical experience<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Necessary qualifications to operate HV equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Expert knowledge of medium- and high-voltage substation electrical equipment including relay protection systems, collection systems, transmission designs, and operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with power generation or distribution preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with establishing HV field service preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office, Project software suites, and SEL Equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with relay and protection fundamentals<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with LOTO and OTO procedures software suit prefered<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Familiarity with the operation of capacitor banks, transformer load tap changers, circuit breakers, and motor\u002Fmanually operated air disconnect switches<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ability to write operating procedures and strong problem-solving ability<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to apply pertinent industry standards and codes including Institute of Electrical &amp; Electronic Engineers (IEEE), National Electric Safety Code (NESC), and ANSI (American National Standards Institute)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to operate a motor vehicle and possession of a valid driver’s license<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to be self-motivated and work with minimal supervision<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to multi-task in a complex and dynamic environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to perform basic electrical mathematical calculations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to read and understand plans, specifications, drawings, and documents relating to engineering and construction including one-line, three-line, schematics, and wiring diagrams<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to work with other crews performing adjacent maintenance and repair<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Willingness and ability to travel at least 30% of the time<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to respond to site emergencies 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, as needed<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to frequently perform physical tasks including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching approximately 75% of the time while on renewable power plants’ sites.  <p> The Services Procurement Manager is responsible for identifying, developing, implementing, and maintaining tools and procedures that support procurement of construction, operations, and engineering services. This position will be on a hybrid remote work schedule, working three days in office and two days from home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Create, implement, and manage a competitive bid process for all services required by EDPR NA<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop contracting strategies and processes for tendering Requests for Proposals, reviewing and leveling vendor proposals, and negotiating contracts that result in the best value possible<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Serve as a liaison between the Procurement, Construction, Engineering, and Operations departments<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop and manage purchasing plans and strategies relating to construction of the company’s wind farms and solar park.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Interface with suppliers during the Request for Proposal process<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain responsibility for bid evaluations, commercial and contractual negotiations, and contract approval prior to contract finalization<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Create a competitive bid process that can be used at all levels of the organization<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with the training of personnel in negotiations and contract management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Oversee the development of standardized processes and templates for all contracting efforts<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Supervise the work of Contracts Analysts and Contracts Associates<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b> <\u002Fb><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>3-4<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>10-20%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Finance, or a related field; support SCADA, Substation Automation, and Energy Management System (EMS) for renewable power generation. You will provide technical expertise during the development and construction of new sites as well as supporting the remote operations control center (ROCC) with day to day operations of existing sites.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> This position will be on a hybrid remote work schedule working three days in office and two days from home.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> MAIN <ul>\n       <li>Contract review (TSA, LGIA, PPA)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Development\u002Freview of technical specifications, scope of work and configuration guidelines<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Review and execute requirements from ISOs, utilities and offtakers<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Design and testing of substation SCADA equipment (relays, IEDs, HMI)<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Development and testing of Automatic generator control (AGC) algorithms<\u002Fli> \n       <li>Execute FAT and plant testing<\u002Fli> \n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n     <li>Support operating facilities with troubleshooting plant\u002Fsubstation control systems, energy management system, communication issues, and telemetry to external entities (offtakers, ISO, TSO)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure power plants are built and operated in compliance with cybersecurity and NERC CIP regulations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop and maintain documentation of existing SCADA infrastructure such as communication diagrams, software configuration guidelines, troubleshooting guides.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Enforce the use of technical specifications and design guidelines to ensure good workmanship<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Interface with and support internal organizations including the ROCC, Asset Operations, Market Operations, and Information Technology<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Interface with and support external entities such as offtakers\u002FISO\u002FTSO, SCADA contractors, Turbine\u002FPV suppliers<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide after-hours support in troubleshooting SCADA, EMS, and communication issues.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>DIRECT REPORTS<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> <\u002Fb>none<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> TRAVEL<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Up to 25%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> SKILLS &amp; <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>GENERAL DESCRIPTION:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Energy Storage Analytics Associate is responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining applications for simulation and real-time operations of energy storage systems, conforming with company strategy, market rules, contract provisions, and performance requirements. The person in this role will assess the revenue potential of storage projects and ensure optimal market participation. This position will be on a hybrid work schedule, working three days in the office and two days at home.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Support the development of optimization models, strategies, and applications for energy storage market participation, under market rules, and contractual and technical constraints.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support the development of forecasting models for nodal energy and ancillary services prices, to be used in the simulation\u002Freal-time operation of energy storage systems.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Collaborate in the development, maintenance, and continuous improvement of applications capable of dispatching energy storage systems, collecting real-time data, and producing performance reports, with high levels of automation.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Estimate revenue projections of energy storage projects of all types under consideration.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Collaborate with Market Operations\u002FGEM in energy sales optimization efforts, related to energy storage systems.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work as part of a team, participating in special projects\u002Fduties as assigned by the team leader.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n sector is preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of Python, Matlab, SQL, Azure, AWS, PowerBI and Microsoft Office software.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with code development and maintenance<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Preferred: Proficient knowledge of Linear Programming and Mixed-Integer Programming and Algebraic Modeling Languages such as AIMMS, GAMS, or Pyomo<\u002Fli> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Exciting entry-level position, the Field Service Technician I (Wind Tech) is an essential member of the Wind or Solar Farm that is responsible for the on-site operations, maintenance, repairs, and replacement of equipment at one of EDPR NA’s wind-energy generation sites. Tasks include but are not limited to completing Lock-Out-Tag-Out (LOTO), Tail Board, and documentation that is necessary to support wind turbine maintenance safely. This team member will also conduct inspections of equipment, tools, and facilities for compliance with EDPR policies, governmental safety guidelines, and environmental regulations. The ideal candidate is seeking an opportunity to showcase their knowledge and skills in a dynamic team setting with a passion for renewable energy as EDPR is changing tomorrow now!<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure proper operation and maintenance of wind turbines and associated wind plant equipment including substation and tower switchgear<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively look for improvement opportunities to job-appropriate processes and procedures and communicate through appropriate channels or implement improvements using the appropriate control management protocol<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify gaps in safety standards and safety risks in the environment, implement effective risk mitigation and provide recommendations to higher-level technical staff and management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Demonstrate and promote integrity, strong initiative, and teamwork<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Comply with all pertinent environmental health and safety programs and act as a safety role model<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with and respond to EDPRs Remote Operations Control Center when necessary to coordinate remote operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Complete all required training in a satisfactory manner and timeframe<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in on-the-job training with on-site personnel<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Document all work performed using computer-based service reporting procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Adhere to internal controls in effect<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>Up to 10%<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>High school diploma or GED<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Must possess a valid driver’s license and be able to operate a motor vehicle.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Effective Communicator<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Mechanical and electrical aptitude<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Troubleshooting and analysis skills.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Exciting entry-level leadership role at the cutting edge of the renewable energy industry. This is a fast-paced, dynamic position at the center of project management and renewable energy development across the eastern United States. The Project Developer works closely with experienced experts in every domain of the utility-scale renewable energy industry (wind, solar, and battery storage). The PD supports the development of projects from early-stage site identification all the way through permitting and construction. The PD is responsible for handling complex tasks and supporting Project Managers on multiple projects. The PD interacts daily with a diversity of internal project teams and external landowners, community stakeholders, and public officials in various project areas. This is a tremendous early-career position for emerging leaders who are seeking professional growth opportunities in the renewable energy industry with numerous training opportunities.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Cover letters are strongly encouraged to be submitted!<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Identify and oversee the development of large-scale wind, solar and battery storage projects by creating and updating project maps and databases using GIS tools<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Represent EDPRNA in the field, working with Project Managers and landowners to create, negotiate, and amend agreements, options, leases, and land sales<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Engage in community outreach and stakeholder management activities<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Organize and attend educational and networking events<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Conduct land, market, regulatory, and related project research<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Compile documentation, attend meetings, conduct necessary studies, and perform other tasks as needed to obtain permits at the local, state, and federal level<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with efforts to secure critical transmission and interconnection contracts from utilities and transmission providers<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Prepare proposals that are submitted to power purchasers including utilities, community choice aggregators, and commercial &amp; industrial customers<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support internal reporting and project tracking efforts<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> up to 65%. Driver’s License required.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Environmental Sciences, or a related field<\u002Fli> \n     <li>1 – 2 years of progressively responsible project management or development experience in energy or a related industry<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong knowledge of ESRI ArcGIS and Google Earth software preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office software with strong Excel skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in Analytical Problem Solving, Strong Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise. (Preferred).<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><b>Behavioral Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Strong organizational and time-management skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>High attention to detail<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to work productively with limited supervision<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong interest in renewable energy<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to travel and work overtime as needed<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Senior Solar Design Engineer is responsible for performing technical and due diligence activities on a variety of EDPR-NA’s early through late stage development assets as well as acquisition projects ranging throughout the US\u002FMexico\u002FCanada markets from organization of project site constraints, assessing site feasibility, and carrying out pre-construction designs of PV and PV plus Storage utility scale projects. Use of modeling software such as NREL SAM and PVSyst will also be required to perform calculations to ensure designs achieve optimal energy production as a function of installed and operational costs. This position will primarily be focused on analyzing projects during the early, mid and late stage phases of the development cycle as well as provide necessary PV and PV plus Storage support to EPC RFP process. This position will be on a hybrid work schedule, working three days in the office and two days from home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Lead project site constraints such as detailed terrain maps, wetland features, flood zone delineations, and other existing exclusion areas with associated construction limitations and setback requirements (such as transmission lines, wetlands, public roadways, pipelines, etc.)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>High proficiency with AutoCAD to convert and prepare all project site data for integration into detailed conceptual layouts and models of utility-scale solar plants.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Utilize various datasets to review proposed project boundary delineations and exclusion zones<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work extensively within PVcase, PVsyst, AutoCAD and other modelling software packages to design pre-construction layouts of utility-scale solar farms using value engineering approach in power block sizing, design of cable management and Medium Voltage (MV) AC collection circuits<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Collaborate closely with various departments throughout the development cycle – Civil Development Engineering, Project Development, Origination, Procurement, Energy Assessment, Project Management Office, Energy Storage Analytics execution Engineering and Construction<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identify opportunities to optimize project return by modifying design parameters such as DC\u002FAC ratio to ensure best Levelized Cost of Energy (LCOE)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Analyze and evaluate new and emerging technologies as part of solar project and hybrid (solar plus storage) design efforts as the market evolves<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Supports the internal technical team with leading initiatives to ground in order to further strengthen EDPR’s position both internally and externally<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide as needed technical support to transmission and development teams for interconnection applications<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide as needed support during the technical due diligence phases of EPC request for proposal (RFP) selection and contracting stages<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Clearly communicate regular and frequent project status updates and other reporting documents with various departments as identified above<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Communicate information continuously and effectively to cross-functional teams<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist in technical vendor reviews and qualifications<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide technical support to Procurement for the preparation and execution of solar RFP’s for vendors and contractors<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Lead and mentor team members and provide training opportunities.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b> <\u002Fb><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>10%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering. Master’s preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>5-8 years of PV design engineering experience with utility scale solar PV systems. Preferably ranging in projects sized at 100 MW and up<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Relevant work experience in the design and development of utility scale solar PV systems<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience in ArcGIS software is preferred but not necessary<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience in AutoCAD, PVSyst and or other software platforms would be a plus<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of full suite of Microsoft Office software; high proficiency in Excel required<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Demonstrates knowledge with solar PV system capacity testing using PVsyst and ASTM E2848-13 standards<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Know how of the solar market such as connections with third party vendors and Independent Engineering (IE’s) preferred, but not necessary.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong knowledge in solar PV modules, trackers and inverters required<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Adequate knowledge of National Electrical Code (NEC) preferred, but not necessary<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Comfortable working in a fast-moving dynamic environment<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Strong written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal, and teamwork skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong technical, analytical, and quantitative skills<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to quickly come up to speed on all technical and commercial subjects related to Solar PV projects<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to quickly understand the basics of a variety of subjects relating to renewable energy including civil and electrical engineering designs and detailed drawings, construction-related processes, environmental, and cultural studies.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong organizational skills and high attention to detail<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to work productively with limited supervision<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong time-management skills and ability to multi-task<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Strong interest in environmental issues and renewable energy<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Business acumen skills. Being able to consider the commercial aspects as well in project designs<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability and willingness to travel and work extended hours as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Understanding of Microsoft products and\u002For complementing products preferred.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in Analytical Problem Solving, Strong Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise preferred<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: rough surfaces when on project sites.<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in  <p> The Procurement Process Associate will bridge the gap between business areas, stakeholders, suppliers and the Procurement department to ensure corporate business requirements are met. They will perform task aligned to the accountabilities listed below. This position will not be limited to specific task and would be asked to perform ad-hoc procurement task at the guidance of Procurement managers and the Procurement Director. This position will be on a hybrid work schedule, working three days in the office and two days from home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Create team<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain local automation processes for Procurement and P2P<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Liaison to Accounting, Finance, HSE and Legal departments<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provides 1st 1-2 business days<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional Procurement duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>SAP Accountabilities: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Acting as a bridge gap demonstrations for key users while performing acceptance tests, end-user training and additional end-user support after go live.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide service as support consultant (SAP, Business Warehouse, Appian and Power BI applications and additional applications) for all procurement processes related but not limited to procurement to pay, contracts and inventory.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Testing, Extracting, transforming and loading sensitive data into the SAP system, completing validation, verification and importing vendor, material and tax-related information.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Business Accountabilities: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Supply chain process management, handling vendors, customers, assuring compliance with both legal requirements and the company’s budget goals. Improvement of internal processes, yielding productivity increase and internal expenses reduction.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop automatic purchase order (MM-PUR), purchase requisition (MM-PUR) processes for movement of materials in stock. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Business Operations Associate is the nexus and decision-enabler for Operations Senior Managers and Directors. You solve key challenges, work across departments, and ensure the information needed to make sound decisions is available. You are responsible for the holistic evaluation of the department’s processes and metrics, identification of areas of improvement, and generation of plans for implementation. Additionally, you will assist the Director of Wind Operations in the optimization and maintenance of the Wind Operations Operating Model which includes meeting structures, the OKR (or similar) process and reporting on key objectives. It is necessary for you to be a self-starter who interfaces well horizontally and vertically across the EDPR organization to ensure the success of projects in the Department. This position will be on a hybrid work schedule, working three days in the office and two days at home.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Establish a structure and cadence of program and function reviews to increase visibility, drive alignment, and reduce blockers<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop and utilize frameworks to help structure team thinking and alignment – creation of a common “performance language”<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Leads and assists the development of change management and business transformation efforts in the Wind Ops group<\u002Fli> \n     <li> Creates opportunities in the business ecosystem by interfacing within Asset Operations and across other departments<\u002Fli> \n     <li> Builds consensus among cross-functional teams and influences decision making of leadership audiences<\u002Fli> \n     <li> Gather and analyze data, formulate, and test hypotheses, synthesize findings, and develop implementation plans to translate recommendations into results<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage central repository of processes and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)<\u002Fli> \n     <li> Identify and implement new initiatives within the department<\u002Fli> \n     <li> Author, manage, and deliver executive level status reports<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Lead the creation, identification, and tracking of metrics to improve business performance in the group as well as inform actions<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Explore new business and operation models throughout the industry to maintain a current view of best practices and improvement opportunities.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Network at all levels within the Asset Operations department and to the Director level in stakeholder departments<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Interface with external customers, investors, and suppliers<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Other duties as required to fulfill the job description<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: situations where only limited standardization exists<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)<\u002Fp>\n Senior Services Procurement Analyst will provide support to the Services Procurement department by supporting multiple competitive bid processes, including negotiating and writing vendor contracts for all services related to the development, design and construction of wind, solar, and battery storage projects. You will also support Procurement’s organization and process team in the supplier qualification process and additional reporting as necessary.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Assist Services Procurement Manager with the development of contracting strategies and processes for tendering Requests for Proposals (RFPs)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively, reviewing and levelizing vendor proposals, identifying potential risk and negotiating contracts that result in the best value possible<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with the creation and documentation of a competitive bid process that can be used at all levels of the organization<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Serve as a liaison between the Procurement, Development, Engineering, Project Management, Finance, and Estimation departments<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage relationships and interfaces with suppliers during the RFP process<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain responsibility for bid evaluations, direct supplier interaction for commercial and contractual negotiations, and contract approval prior to contract finalization<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with the creation and documentation of a competitive bid process that can be used at all levels of the organization<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with the contract award process and produce the presentation of award recommendations to executive level management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide support to the organization and processes function including tracking supplier qualification documents for the approval of suppliers to ensure timely and accurate processing to meet deadlines<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage documentation, contracts, budgets, schedules, engineering and construction interfaces, project controls, project correspondence, and project reporting on a weekly basis<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Organize and prepare agendas for meetings between suppliers and Procurement personnel<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Direct reports: <\u002Fb>0<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel:<\u002Fb> 0% - 10%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor’s degree in a Business related field, Engineering or Construction<\u002Fli> \n     <li>3+ years of professional related supply chain, business operations, engineering, construction management, or industry manufacturing experience, including experience with external contract negotiation for services<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with procurement, contract and project management preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Thorough knowledge of the competitive bid process for construction and engineering services and negotiation techniques<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office software and familiarity with e-enabled supply chain systems (e.g., Oracle, SAP)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in Analytical <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Senior Transmission Associate will ensure adequate transmission exists for all of the company’s development projects. You will track regulatory developments in assigned markets in order to advise the project team in handling all transmission-related issues and minimizing potential risks for the company. This position will be on a hybrid work schedule, working three days in the office and two days at home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Perform transmission load flow and LMP analysis and run models of the ISO system to determine impact on EDPR’s wind portfolio<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Analyze, forecast, and provide guidance regarding Financial Transmission Rights (FTRs), forward prices, transmission congestion, and LMP basis price spread<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide transmission strategy and guidance to developers<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proactively work to ensure that changes in market rules will favor EDPR’s portfolio<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with project developers to ensure each project has adequate transmission or the access needed to ensure competitiveness<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support Market Operations and the rest of the Energy Management team in all transmission-related matters<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Mitigate transmission risks within EDPR’s portfolio<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with negotiations staff to answer transmission-related questions<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Responsible for transmission procurement in primary and secondary markets<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Represent EDPR’s interests in regional meetings<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage EDPR's TRS queues and TSR portfolio<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><b>Direct reports<\u002Fb>: None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b>Travel:<\u002Fb> 0-10%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b>Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Master’s degree preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>3 - 7 years in the utility industry; generation interconnection experience preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Thorough knowledge of FERC, OATT, OTD, RTOP, and NERC policies<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office software<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Thorough knowledge of PSSE and Power Flow software<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Familiarity with Microsoft Project preferred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in Analytical Problem Solving, Strong Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Capital Equipment Procurement Manager will lead the selection and procurement of wind turbines for the North American market. This person will create a sustainable competitive advantage for the company and maximize value throughout the development, construction, and operations of EDPR projects through negotiating multifaceted renewable energy supply and service agreements. This position will be on a hybrid remote work schedule, working three days in the office and two days from home.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Lead North American strategic sourcing organization for wind turbines<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Responsible for evaluating product options and making recommendations for product selections<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Negotiate and manage Master Supply Agreements and Operations and Maintenance Agreements for power generation equipment that provide required flexibility and appropriate technology to meet the needs of utility-scale wind across the EDPR portfolio<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Negotiate project-specific supply, operations, and warranty agreements for projects entering the construction phase in any given year based on inputs from Market Intelligence, Finance, Development, Legal, Project Management Office, Engineering, Construction, and Asset Management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Procure equipment to support the qualification of EDPR projects for Production Tax Credits and manage the inventories and allocation of such equipment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Lead competitive bid processes according to guidelines established by EDPR NA<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Serve as primary contact for North America, with suppliers for wind turbines<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop market intel pricing benchmarks to forecast capital equipment pricing<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Provide support to:<\u002Fli> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Project Management Office on budget and scheduling<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Origination team with Power Purchase Agreement (PPA) pricing<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Finance team with cash flow forecasting<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Market Intelligence team with business plan development<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Operations team with establishing and managing operations supply chain<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Engineering team with technical design<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Construction team as liaison with suppliers throughout delivery and commissioning<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Development team with project prospecting and layouts<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <li>Implement and develop strategies for:<\u002Fli> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Wind turbines procurement on a global scale to the overall benefit of EDPR<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Contracting and procurement as market conditions evolve in order to provide quality of prices within the business plan while encouraging third-party development<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Various procurement processes and procedures as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <li>Maintain responsibility for bid evaluations, commercial and contractual negotiations, and contract approval prior to contract finalization<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with training of personnel in negotiations and contract management<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with the development of standardized processes and templates for all contracting efforts<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Additional duties as required<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b> Direct reports: <\u002Fb>4 - 5<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>Up to 25%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Minimum qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering, or a related field<\u002Fli> \n     <li>5+ years of relevant experience, strong preference for wind turbine procurement or sales experience<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to read, write, and negotiate contracts<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Office software<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Competency in Analytical Problem Solving, Strong Communication, Customer\u002FPartner Relationships, and Technology Expertise. (Preferred).<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Behavioral requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Strong analytical skills and problem-solving ability<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Leadership skills and ability to be self-motivated<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p> <b>Physical demands &amp; working conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility<\u002Fb>: Ability to frequently perform physical tasks including standing, sitting, walking, kneeling, bending, twisting, squatting, and reaching approximately 50% of the time while on WF or PV sites; ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment.<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Walking: <\u002Fb>Ability to walk.25 to .5 miles per day, including across unpaved and rough surfaces when on WF or PV sites.<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to read and write English and Spanish proficiently; ability to interpret, deliver, and follow a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b>Lifting:<\u002Fb> Ability to lift items weighing up to 10 pounds.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b>Vision\u002FHearing<\u002Fb>: Ability to interpret and follow a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b>Safety:<\u002Fb> Ability to understand and communicate safety precautions when necessary.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Qualifications<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Education<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>Required<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        Bachelors or better.\n       <\u002Fdiv> \n      <\u002Fdiv>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Equal Opportunity Employer\u002FProtected Veterans\u002FIndividuals with Disabilities<\u002Fp> \n   <p>The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> EDPR NA Distributed Generation’s Asset Management team is responsible for overseeing solar photovoltaic projects across the United States. The team optimizes system performance, generates reports, manages contracts, overseesand maintenance, repair, troubleshooting with the goal of ensuring the safe and efficient operation of these projects.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> The Asset Management Analyst provides commercial management support to ensure that all of EDPR DG’s commercial and governmental obligations are met. This role will be responsible for maintaining a database of key information about our operating projects, onboarding new projects, contract and government compliance tasks, contract management, and will support the boarder asset management team overseeing our projects.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> EDPR DG is an extremely fast-growing Company and we are looking for an energetic and mission driven team member that enjoys change, will own this role and is committed to taking it to the next level.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Ensure schedules, dates, tasks, deliverables and other important information is properly documented.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure that asset\u002Fland owner obligations and interests are successfully administered under the asset’s project and financing agreements and that general business-related license, permit and regulatory requirements, reporting and transactions with regional authorities, banks, tax assessors, governing and other external parties are successfully managed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Work with other staff to ensure reporting obligations are met in a timely manner<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Notify relevant staff and helps to resolve issues when milestones are delinquent or a trigger event has occurred<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with the management and execution incentive procurement\u002Fbilling, regulatory reporting and PPA billing.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Coordinate integration of new assets into portfolio and streamline asset handover process.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Onboard new projects into our existing databases which would include reviewing agreements and contracts for deliverables, and all project related documentation for the key data that is tracked<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform financial and technical optimization analyses of asset portfolios.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support and maintain project level budgets as well as budget reporting. Perform variance analysis on project operating expenses to identify deviations, rectify errors, and apply lessons learned<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Track portfolio performance and recommend optimization strategies.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Maintain internal documents and records of customer requests, work or services performed, inventory and other O&amp;M information.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Coordinate and track efforts to ensure timely progress and satisfactory resolution of issues with service providers<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in a joint effort with Asset Management team, performing ad-hoc analyses of the historical and forward-looking performance of the asset<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Develop market knowledge regarding projects’ respective electricity markets<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Collaborate with other staff to ensure that proper asset management processes and tasks are in place in order to improve overall facility <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p>Gerneral Desscription :<\u002Fp> \n    <div> \n     <p>Provide technical support and cooperation with the origination teams from the operative region of North America and M&amp;A, for the analysis of business opportunities and initiatives worldwide, related wind farm, PV plant and BESS projects. Compile, process and analyze the technical information needed for the project assessment in order to ensure the application of uniform criteria when considering different investment alternatives enabling the best selection of projects.<\u002Fp> \n     <p><b> <\u002Fb><b>1. <\u002Fb><b>PROJECT TECHNICAL ASSESSMENT:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n     <p> Define and execute the scope of the technical assessment, according the internal practices the potential new project state: early development, advance development, ready to build, pre-construction, under construction, in commissioning or operational.<\u002Fp> \n     <p> As part of it, the following tasks and steps will be performed in order to assess all the technical matters related the wind farm, PV plant or BESS projects and its relevant electrical infrastructures:<\u002Fp> \n     <ul> \n      <li>Perform the technical analysis of the available project documents.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Execute the project site visits and report.<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <p><b>PROJECT ASSESSMENT:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n     <ul>\n      <li>General technical assessment, including location and physical connections.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Project layout and footprint assessment, including influence area, occupied lands, noise receptors, existent infrastructures interferences, as HVL, etc.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Environmental conditions assessment, as altitude, temperature, seismic, wind, etc.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Ground conditions assessment, including geology, geotechnical and hydrology.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Electrical system studies assessment, as shortcircuit study, load flow analysis, etc.<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <p><b>PERMITS AND LICENSES TECHNICAL ASSESSMENT<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Identify the global project administrative state, identifying the principal technical constraints and hazards for getting the final licenses and estimated deadlines.<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <div>\n     <p><b>WTG TECHNOLOGY ASSESSMENT<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Coordinate with Technology the review of the project WTG model suitability study and the available IECRE Type certificate and estimated useful life.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Coordinate with Technology the review the noise study.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Coordinate with Technology the review the technical capability of the WTG model and the defined PPC and SCADA system for the grid code compliance.<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <p><b>WIND FARM ACCESS AND BOB DESIGN ASSESSMENT<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Assess the route survey feasibility and main works and the main access and roads and cranepads design and technical specifications.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Assess the foundation design, assessing if follows the applicable regulations and standards.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Assess the MV collection system design.<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <p><b>PV PLANT PRINCIPAL EQUIPMENT TECHNOLOGY ASSESSMENT<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Coordinate with Technology the review of the selected principal equipment, modules, racking system and inverters, verifying the technical capability of the inverter model and the defined PPC and SCADA system for the grid code compliance.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Coordinate with Technology the review of the wind load study of the structure and dynamic stability analysis, concluding the suitability for the site and assessing the expected useful life.<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <p><b>PV PLANT BOP DESIGN ASSESSMENT<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Assess the route survey to the site, the access and internal roads design and technical specifications.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Assess the structures foundation design.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Assess the MV collection system and LV design.<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <p><b>BESS TECHNOLOGY AND BOP DESIGN ASSESSMENT<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Coordinate with Technology the review of the selected BESS and ESMS, assessing if complies the projects capabilities requests.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Assess the route survey to the site, the access and internal roads design and technical specifications.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Assess the foundation design of the BESS and inverters containers.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Assess the MV collection system and the LV auxiliary services design.<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <p><b>ELECTRICAL INFRASTRUCTURE DESIGN ASSESSMENT<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Coordinate the review of the project substation and interconnection substation designs, including the HV and MV equipment, the Integrated Control and Protection systems, metering, auxiliary.<\u002Fli> \n      <li>Coordinate the review of the design of the High Voltage Line and materials technical specification.<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <p><b>CONSTRUCTION<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb><b>ASSESSMENT<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n     <ul>\n      <li>For those projects in pre-construction or construction phases, and also for operational projects when applicable, it will be performed a technical assessment including Construction contracts and related warranties, QA\u002FQC plans, Construction planning up to COD.<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n     <p><b>PROJECT PRE-DESIGN<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n     <ul>\n      <li>Identify the technical upsides and levers that optimize the project, mitigating identified technical risks, reducing CAPEX and\u002For increasing the revenues. Execute the needed predesigns of the civil, mechanical and electrical infrastructures of the power plant to implement each of the levers.<\u002Fli> \n     <\u002Ful>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <p><b>CAPEX ESTIMATION:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Prepare an accurate and optimum CAPEX estimation of the potential project or investment opportunity.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Prepare the CAPEX estimation for the additional studied scenarios through the executed pre-engineering.<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><b>RISK ASSESSMENT:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Evaluate the technical risk of the project, identifying all the factors that could affect the development, design, construction and commissioning of the future power plant and assessing its probability potential consequences.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> PROJECT PLANNING ASSESSMENT<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Assess the project master plan from the Vendor, considering the inputs related permitting from the Business Development area, and developing the own schedule for the engineering, procurement and construction phases.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> CONTRACTS<\u002Fb><b> ASSESSMENT:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Support the Legal, M&amp;A and Business Development teams along the preparation of the Supplemental Purchase Agreements and Development Service Agreements, ensuring that all the agreed technical scopes and conditions are well covered.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> TRANSVERSAL SUPPORT COORDINATION:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Ensure the coordination of service provision from the Local E&amp;C team and the different Technology areas, as Civil &amp; Mechanical, Electrical &amp; Control, PV Technology, BESS Technology, and BESS engineering.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Coordinate the planned works and project information continuously and effectively to cross- functional teams, collaborate closely with various departments including M&amp;A, Development, Origination, Procurement, Finance, Energy Assessment and O&amp;M. <b>REPORTING:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Produce the projects preliminary principal finding reports and the final Technical Due Diligence report including the technical assessment,<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Actively develop and manage reports to management by producing regular and frequent project status updates and other reporting documents.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> PROJECT DUE DILIGENCE TENDERS:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Prepare the RfPs for contracting the engineering and studies to external consultants. Review and evaluate the offers ensuring the selection of the best offer.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> COORDINATION OF PROJECT TRANSFER:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Lead the transfer of the acquired projects to the Local E&amp;C Team, ensuring the delivery of the full package of the VDR technical information and the developed information along the project technical assessment and pre-engineering.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> STANDARDIZATION:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Follow the application of the common standards in the projects, supervising its adaptation to applicable local regulation, in order to avoid non justified deviations and maximize the investment efficiency with all the technical warranty needed.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> COMPANY POLICY AND LEGAL COMPLIANCE:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Understand and apply policies to prevent occupational hazards, environment and quality to ensure implementation and compliance on tasks under their responsibility.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> EDPR INSTITUTIONAL REPRESENTATION:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Represent EDPR to agencies and institutions, public and private, in matters relating to its jurisdiction to enforce the interests of EDPR.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> PHYSICAL DEMANDS &amp; WORKING CONDITIONS:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility:<\u002Fb> Ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading:<\u002Fb> Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or scheduled form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Lifting:<\u002Fb> Ability to lift items weighing up to 10 pounds<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Vision\u002FHearing:<\u002Fb> Ability to understand a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Safety:<\u002Fb> Ability to understand and communicate safety precautions<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Equal Opportunity Employer\u002FProtected Veterans\u002FIndividuals with Disabilities<\u002Fp> \n   <p>The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> Provides strategic leadership in the areas of startup and commissioning for a rolling portfolio of wind, solar, and storage projects mitigating risk by proactively identifying, assessing and addressing potential issues. Provides tactical leadership and strategic direction to a team committed to ensuring a smooth transition from construction to operational phase and confirming that all operational requirements are met. Develops strategic programs and tools that provide direction for projects during construction through handoff to the Operations team. Ensures that safety, quality, cost, environmental, landowner, and legal requirements are achieved or exceeded while accomplishing project objectives. <\u002Fp>\n    <p><b>Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li> Provides strategic leadership and direction for team responsible for the startup and commissioning of new wind, solar, and storage projects from mechanical completion through final handover to Operations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Directly manages and oversees the Sr. HV Commissioning Manager and team as well as the Sr. Non-HV Commissioning Manager and team<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Capable of performing hands-on management role for some individual projects during construction, as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Coordinates various stakeholders needed to work collaboratively on project startup and commissioning activates<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develops effective relationships with internal departments, contractors, suppliers, landowners, and <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>General Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The NERC System Manager will be responsible for managing, analyzing, installing, configuring, upgrade, testing, documenting, monitoring, and maintaining software and hardware in support of NERC technical and business processing requirements. Supported applications and systems may include operating systems, technical applications, server hardware, security tools, monitoring tools, Web servers, Application servers, Integration servers, and other NERC applications or systems. This position will be on a hybrid work schedule, working three days in the office and two days at home.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The NERC System Manager must participate in the development and execution of NERC technology strategies to support EDPR’s activities and direction.<\u002Fp> \n    <p> Provides advanced level support for applications and systems; including troubleshooting, performance, monitoring, cost-benefit, security, and licensing analysis.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p> <\u002Fp>\n    <p><b>Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n CIP.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Evaluate network and systems changes\u002Fexpansions for NERC security compliance.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Participate in security audits and conducts other functions independently or jointly with other departments<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Prepares and\u002For assists with the development of company standards such as security procedures and computing equipment specifications<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Daily reviews security auditing tools and logs for unusual activity and responds appropriately.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage company NERC server infrastructure (Windows and Linux) ; apply patches and perform upgrades as needed<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage company NERC applications including changes, upgrades, fixes, and user requests<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Create and update NERC system, application, and network documentation, following proper control standards for NERC CIP<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Responsible for the implementation of NERC policies and procedures with a focus on physical and logical security &amp; compliance (CIP)<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Respond to user issues and requests, record solutions in IT Ticketing system<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Oversee and drive continuous improvement to reduce and eliminate operational issues.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop and implement processes and procedures to ensure compliance with internal controls, regulatory requirements, and operational standards.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Analyze and recommend different sorts of architectural system, assessment of hardware and software related problem and resolve issues.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Contribute to internal control actions through risk assessments and lessons learned<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Evaluate, prepare, and maintain materials for audits, Standard Audit Worksheets (RSAWs), and evidence documentation<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Identifies process improvement opportunities based on internal compliance assessments, root cause analysis, and industry best practice<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Complete annual review of processes, procedures and integrate current CIP procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Perform additional duties as assigned<\u002Fli>\n
