<p> The Operations Environmental Senior Analyst will support EDPR North America’s operating assets with environmental regulatory compliance matters and EDPR NA’s ISO 14001 certified Environmental, Health &amp; Safety Management System (EHSMS) and will also manage environmental compliance for projects under construction while creating and promoting a culture of environmental excellence and consummate compliance with standards and regulations.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Manage environmental construction compliance for EDPR NA’s Managers regarding the interpretation of environmental regulations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist operating sites with compliance with federal, state, and local permitting and regulatory environmental requirements<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure that permits are obtained, renewed, and closed as needed for operating assets<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage project obligation tracker for operating assets to ensure that fulfillment of permit obligations are documented<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure that environmental plans and programs are implemented and maintained as required by federal, state, and local regulatory requirements for operating assets<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Develop, maintain, and improve on a waste management program that strives to minimize waste generation and waste management-related risks<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Conduct annual compliance assessments of select operating assets<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage, control, and administer environmental management system documents and procedures<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Support EDPR NA’s Environmental Health &amp; Safety Management System (EHSMS) and improvements for operating assets<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ensure that environmental financing decisions for EDPR NA. This position will be on a hybrid remote work schedule, working three days in the office and two days remotely.<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n plan, etc.) using best practices such as benchmarking, process analysis and VBA programming<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Use quantitative methods and statistical techniques (leveraging data tools) to perform enhanced financial valuations for structuring and execution of third-party financial transactions including tax equity partnerships (partnership flip, sale-and-lease back, ITC multiple, etc.), project finance, or back-leverage financings<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Assist with due diligence processes and perform underlying research for internal EDPR NA teams and external parties (auditors, appraisers, technical consultants, etc.), under the supervision of a senior Finance team member<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Manage model related funding deliverables and timelines for financing<\u002Fli> \n financial structures per the guidance of senior Finance team members and in collaboration with the Tax team<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Research possibility for further automation of internal processes using data tools and programming<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Direct reports: <\u002Fb>None<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>0 – 10%<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Job Details\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p>Description<\u002Fp> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <p><b>GENERAL DESCRIPTION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <p> The PMO Rotational Analyst is a multi-faceted role working in collaboration with other teams in EDPR’s Project Management Organization (PMO) and with other teams across the business. You will work under the guidance of the different team leads to support various work streams within the PMO. You can expect to learn about and support some or all of the following work streams:<\u002Fp> \n    <ul> \n     <li>Providing oversight and support to project teams throughout the development and construction of renewable energy assets to help project teams manage the budget, schedule, and risk profile for their projects<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Creating accurate, market-driven estimates for project pricing\u002Fmarketing and investment approvals<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Creating and maintaining project schedules and templates<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Supporting the creation and implementation of project management tools and initiatives<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Managing the sustainability and waste reporting program<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p>This position will be based at EDPRs North America headquarters in Houston, TX. The rotation program will consist of a series of 6–12-month assignments with different PMO teams. Your first rotation will be with the Business Process Excellence team and will be focused on sustainability and waste reporting. Upon completing the rotation program, you will work with PMO leadership to identify a long-term role within the company.<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Main Accountabilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>You will undergo technical training during onboarding. Throughout your rotations, there will be a variety of assignments, including performing analysis, designing reports and dashboards, assisting with data collection, supporting process improvements, and other duties and projects as needed.<\u002Fli> \n     <li>You will also supporting certain administrative and scheduling tasks to support Executive Vice President and Project Management team<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful> \n    <p><b>Travel: <\u002Fb>0%<\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Employment Type: <\u002Fb>Full-time employee<\u002Fp>\n    <br> \n    <p><b> Minimum Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor’s degree or better in Business, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field<\u002Fli> \n     <li>0-2 years of work experience<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Proficient with at least one modern programming language<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with Power BI or similar data visualization tools<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience in business consulting or technical project management is a plus<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Experience with relational databases is a plus<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Behavioral Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical skills, can synthesize information and offer recommendations<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Eagerness to learn<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to work in a fast-paced and collaborative environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Possess excellent attention to detail<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Ability to be self-motivated<\u002Fli> \n     <li>Superb social skills<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <p><\u002Fp> \n    <p><b> Physical Demands &amp; Working Conditions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n    <ul>\n     <li><b>Sitting\u002FStanding\u002FFlexibility: <\u002Fb>Ability to stand and sit for 8 or more hours when in an office environment<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Speech\u002FReading: <\u002Fb>Ability to speak, read, and write English proficiently and deliver a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Lifting: <\u002Fb>Ability to lift items weighing up to 10 pounds<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Vision\u002FHearing: <\u002Fb>Ability to understand a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form<\u002Fli> \n     <li><b>Safety:<\u002Fb> Ability to understand and communicate safety precautions when necessary<\u002Fli> \n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <p>Equal Opportunity Employer\u002FProtected Veterans\u002FIndividuals with Disabilities<\u002Fp> \n   <p>The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.
